Title: All that and a bag of chips.
Review: I had no idea this machine would be so easy to use and do so much more than I expected.

Title: Kicks the crap out of my old Epson
Review: This is a great printer.  Really solidly built with a bajillion and one functions.  Mostly though, it just does what a printer should do.  It prints fast, it scans nicely, and it duplexes right out of the box.

Title: Get this Printer!
Review: Disclaimer: I did not save money and bought this at Staples. Price here is pretty good.6 weeks ago, I cleaned house. 3 HP printers tossed out: none working, all between 6-10 years old. I was left with a 4 year old Lexmark with Wi-Fi. It was "OK" but not great. Hey, it worked [most of the time].2 weeks ago on a Thursday night at 8:50 PM my 16 yo son needed to print his homework, and the Lexmark was spewing Red ["Cyan"] everywhere. Broken. My wife said "Get the HP 8600 Pro Plus". Why? She has 4 of them in her office, and the entire staff swears by it! [If my wife likes it, it must be a good printer.]Ran to Staples, got this, and by 11 PM had it working.It is sweet. Print is concise, colors are very good. I can print from my droid phone[!], and it has been perfect including the ability to scan to pdf, a must for me.They kill you on the ink [hello: they all do] and you MUST use HP ink cartridges [no more easy inky refills that I am aware]. We use XP, Vista, Win 7 and I have a Surface Pro 2 with Win 8.1 [no CD drive] and HP has all of the Drivers and software needed on their website for download. Nice...This printer is a workhorse and very intuitive. So far it has been the best printer purchase ever, and I've had quite a few.I like this...at least so far.

Title: Good printer
Review: I purchased this printer because it received the best reviews for it's class.Pros:Fast printingCheap per page costsWireless with remote print capabilitiesAll-in-one capabilitesCons:Large, bulky

Title: HP OfficeJet 8600
Review: This is the worst printer I've ever owned. It constantly gets "paper jam" errors yet when I remove the back, there is no evidence of a genuine paper jam. After I power cycle the printer, It feeds that piece of paper through (which it couldn't do if there was a real paper jam) and attempts to print on the next page before it too gets a paper jam error. After repeating this drill four or five times I sometimes actually get my printout. This printer is less than a year old. After researching this, I find that this is a widespread problem with this piece of junk and that HP has not owned up to it. DO NOT BUY THIS DEFECTIVE PRINTER!

Title: Best printer for a Low price
Review: I have had many HP printers but for the price I  paid at Amazon this is the best HP you can get. Black and Colors are superb Ink lasts longer then the H{P Photosmart I replaced.

Title: Missing, upside down engineered
Review: I guess they forgot to finish the design of this product.  While it is wired to my computer and wireless to others in the house.  It as many limitations.  You cannot access much of the information from your computer monitor.  You have to do all the copying from the little screen and much of the faxing.  You can not use your computer at all for any copy jobs (AT ALL).  That all is one from the printers little touch screen and may take up to 5 or 6 touches to do a process.  You cannot view or access your fax log from your monitor - it all has to be done from the printer touch screen.  Now the instructions say that you can have your faxes save to you computer but, it have to be re-installed or set back up almost, on a daily bases. And it looses contact with my computer about twice a week so I have to turn it off and restart it Twice a week.  I figured that if I get the software updates from HP it might improve but it seem to make it worse.  I usually have to start over on the setup of all the functions.  Typical HP.

Title: A perfect AiO
Review: Sturdy construction, easy to install because of animated instructions, less expensive to run because of separate ink cartridges for each of .three colors + black. Quiet, flawless operation.

Title: non-existent paper jam, error message will not clear
Review: This printer worked fine for almost a year, then stopped printing anything.  A bogus error message about a paper jam in the rear duplex tray would not go away no matter what I did.  There never was any paper jam; either a bad sensor or bad software is to blame.  I will be selling my HP stock.

Title: Fine printer/scanner for the money.
Review: We now have two of these units, one at our residence and one at our vacation home.  Both were easy to set up for wireless printing (from Macs, iPads, and iPhones).  The best thing is that the ink cartridges are HUGE and seem to last forever (at least 2 - 3 months with our printing requirements).  We have had no serious mechanical or electronic issues.  The one warning:  Use HP ink cartridges.  Every time we tried to use an off-brand, or to substitute a re-filled cartridge, we had problems.  Small price to pay for reliability, I think.

Title: great printer
Review: Easy wireless setup. Not great for someone who isn't familiar with setting up wireless network components. Print quality is excellent and fast.

Title: Typical HP quality!
Review: It's been many years since I've owned a non-HP printer, and I've never been disappointed.  This model keeps my streak intact.  HP quality and performance simply can't be beat.  Setup was quick and simple, and performance is exceptional across the board.  If the ink cartridges last as long as estimated--or anywhere near estimates--I'll be pleased as Punch.  This is the perfect all-in-one solution for the wireless home office.  Highly recommend!

Title: High quality
Review: This printer is high quality and produces pictures equivalent to those of my photo printer. The auto feed tray and double sided scanning is wonderful. However, sometimes if you only have a couple of papers, you have to push in the first one. After 5000 sheets in six months, I have yet to have any issues other than that one

Title: Cannot be installed on wireless network!
Review: Stay away from this printer. In spite of hours of efforts I haven't been able to install it on my network of 3 MACS - it works fine wirelessly with them - and a PC - where it doesn't. I've lost hours scouting the Web and the HP support pages without finding a solution. Stay away from this printer! Don't let yourself be fooled by the reviews as I have been. If you aren't convinced, go onto the Net and search under problems with HP 8600.

Title: Great Pinter
Review: I got this for my son's office.  He uses his Ipad and Iphone for everything and want to print wirelessly.  After it was set up and I stopped by I printed from my Note II without a problem.  By printing on both sides saves you money on printing supplies

Title: Prints beautifully
Review: The only problem is that it sometimes fails to refresh the wireless connection; I have tried turning it off and on, but the only way to refresh seems to be to unplug it - which is not recommended by the manufacturer.Print quality is very good, it doesn't seem to drink ink like some printers - if not for the matter of the wireless, I'd rate it 5!

Title: Best and fastest printer
Review: This is the third one I have purchased. Mine it two years old and I bought both my son's one for Christmas

Title: Love my new prrinter, etc
Review: I had searched several places and prices for a replacement printer, scanner, fax, copier.  My previous one was also HP which I loved but was old.  This model does everythingg I need with great quality, speed, clarity.  Instructions were easy to follow.Amazon had the best price so I bought it there.  Delivery was prompt and efficient.

Title: HP finally gets it right
Review: We had HP's first WiFi printer. Nightmare. Hesitant to buy this one but it came up number one in Mt demanding criteria. Glad to report it's heads and tails over the old model.

Title: I was pleasantly surprised
Review: I tend to over-research things before I buy them, and for once I purchased this All-In-One Printer without reading the comments of the people who bought it--on the basis of CNet's recommendation.  After purchasing I happened to read the user's comments on CNet, and they were predominantly negative.  I crossed my fingers that it was due to the tendency for more people who are unhappy with their purchase to post a comment, than people who are happy with it.  Luckily, that seems to be the case!I'm a mac user, and the hardware seems to be wonderful, the printer prints consistently and beautifully, and my only complaint at this point is that I didn't look at the measurements--the unit is "Pro" as in "Office-Sized."  But I'm really happy with it.  I haven't had it long enough to know if ink is expensive or not, so I can't speak to the unit's economy of use, but the ink cartridges that came with it are still cranking out quality copies several weeks later--a good sign.

Title: An unnecessary demanded request to review your services.
Review: I find it ridiculous to demand these reviews, if I like the product and the service I will show that appreciation by using the services  again.  I can go to brick and mortar stores and not be browbeat into a review.In this case I am quite pleased with the product and the delivery.Only the demand for a review is at question.

Title: Nice Printer
Review: Everything set up easily just as it was supposed to. Even was able to get the cloud printing via an email address to work first time out.  Ink Cartridges for the printer are somewhat expensive but then again seems HP makes more money off its ink then it does the printer itself.  Print quality is good and was even able to find everything I needed on line to add another the printer to another computer.

Title: Why I hate this printer.
Review: Actually, why you should hate any Hewlett Packard printer.I purchased the Officejet Pro 8600 printer 18-24 months ago and it worked great.  Several months later Apple introduced its new operating system, Mavericks.  HP has not updated it's software to accommodate Mavericks and I have been waiting patiently.  Finally I called HP and they told me they have no plans on doing so, but suggested I purchase another printer from them at a discount.They have no plans on updating the software so they can force you to abandon a perfectly good printer and purchase another one.  Which, I assume, they will not support in a few months when Apple introduces its next operating system.To be fair it does work most of the time when wired to the printer using USB.  It doesn't work using WiFi.To add to my frustration with HP they tell you its time to refill your cartridges long before they are empty, trying to get you throw away an ink cartridge that may be capable of printing hundreds of additional pages,  And, recently I put a brand new HP brand ink cartridge in the printer and it rejected it saying it had expired!!3/8 Update:  And another thing, if you refill one of their ink cartridges the printer will not accept it!!!I hate Hewlett Packard as a company and you should too.

Title: Got a defect product but good refund service!!
Review: The product functions are matched with what I needed.  However, one major function (ADF - auto document feeder) does not work.  This means you could not do a batch copy/scan/fax..  So, decide to return the product.  Then, found out the return process is very simple and actually got full refund..  So, I give a good rating in turn of product and service provided by Amazon.  Will continue to buy product from Amazon in this case!!

Title: Had to send back.
Review: Found that buying used is not the way to go.  Plus it doesn't come withwindows 8 software although it is downloadable.

Title: amazing
Review: I have been using this printer for the last three months, and I have been pleasantly surprised with how much it does, at such reasonable price. The print/scan/copy quality is quite good. I really like the Apps functionality. I routinely use coloring/arts and crafts apps to print stuff for my kids, who really love this printer too! The duplex printing and scanning works really well too.On the negative side: when the paper supply is low, the printer sometimes will draw more than one page to print a sheet. This obviously messes up the printout. Another slightly negative thing is the accuracy of the touchpad. If you're used to the touch accuracy of and iPhone, you may be annoyed. I'm used to it now though.

Title: Wireless Not So Much...
Review: We have had this printer for around a year and a half.  Last June, the wireless connectivity became a huge problem.  Sometimes it would be connected but the computer wouldn't see it.  Other times, it wasn't connected at all.  And occasionally, things printed!  We spent hours researching and troubleshooting, and found a work-around.  Generally, when the printer initially boots (for me, at least), it is connected for about 15 minutes, so I try to keep it shut down unless I need it.  When I do need it and it has been in standby mode for a length of time, I bring it up, shut it off, wait a few minutes, boot it back up, and viola!  The stinkin thing works!I love this printer other than having this problem.  The print quality is great, and it's versatile.  I love being able to print pictures from it, as well as copy and scan.  The wireless problem is a huge 2-star discount though: our initial plan was to get a printer with wireless so we could hide it away somewhere and no have a large chunk of desk space obliterated.  FAIL!  It takes up a good amount of desk space, and if I ever want to print from my phone, I may as well be at the computer, because I have to sit beside it while I do the reboot.On a positive note, at least it works after a year and a half!  Our last one was a Lexmark that died 3 days out of warranty!

Title: Very nice!
Review: This printer does so much more than I thought a printer could do. I do not see myself using all the features, but it is nice to know I have them. So far this printer has no problems and works great.

Title: Huge in size, but exceeds in every way
Review: All the reviews are clear about this being a big printer.  Its look is imposing, but the footprint is barely larger than the Lexmark Pro it replaced. It's tall but that's because it has an awesome Auto Feed, and it was do double-sided scans.  Huge time-saver.  The print speed is incredible in B&W, and not much slower for Color.  The color copy quality is excellent.  Haven't printed photos - but would be surprised if it wasn't at the same quality as the rest of the functions.  Being able to print, fax and email from your mobile devices is such a bonus.

Title: Legit
Review: works so far. had it for 3 days and has worked just fine. haven't tried the twin side printing yet!

Title: Starts great. Breaks quickly
Review: I was very happy with the 8600 for about a year then it fell apart and HP customer service was horrible. Lines appeared on the scanner and every solution online didn't work. The "pick up motor" failed making the printer inoperable (google "HP 8600 pick up motor" and you'll find enough heartache to avoid buying this machine). This is a one-year printer and then it will need replacing.

Title: GOOD PRINTER
Review: I'M A HOME USER THAT TRIES 2 OTHER PRINTERS BEFORE THIS, (which I returned)). AN EPSON WHICH WOULDNT COMMUNICATE WITH MY CP, (after 2 hrs on the phone the teck told me I had a windows issue), AN A BROTHER WHICH WAS MORE EXPENSIVE THAN THIS BUT KEPT BLOWING THE 11 AMP ELECTRIC BREAKER. I HAD A FRIEND WITH ME TO HELP SET IT UP AS MY EYESIGHT ISN'T WHAT IT USED TO BE.AFTER PLUCGGING IT IN THE SMART INSTALL TOOK OVER AND WE BOTH WERE AMAXZED AT HOW THE PRINTER WAS DOING THE ENTRE INSTALL WITHOUT US HAVING TO PUT THE SOFTWARE DISK, (included),IN THE PC TO LOAD. THO ONLY INPUT NEEDED ARE THE PERSONAL SET-UP SETTINGS FOR FAX AND PRINTING. (paper size, orientation, etc), IT SEEMS COMPLICATED TO USE AT FIRST BUT IT' ACTUALLY PRETTY INTUITIVE. JUST A LITTLE HANDS ON AND YOU'RE READY TO GO. I GOT A PAPER JAM ONCE, (which was my fault because I didn't properly align the paper in the adf), BUT IT CLEARED EASILY. JUST LIFT UP THE ADF AS IF YOU WERE SCANNING FROM THE GLASS AND ON THE BOTTOM OF THE ADF IS THE JAMMED PAPER WHICH YOU JUST PULL OUT.FIRST COPY OUT, FROM SLEEP MODE, TAKES ABOUT 12 SECONDS WHICH IS SLOW, ( i had a canon that did it in just over 4 sec), BUT AFTER THAT THEY SHOOT OUT ABOUT EVERY 2 SECONDS. IT IS NOISER THAN MY OLD CANON AND I WOULD RATHER HAVE A ;IGHTER COLOR, (ivory or light gray), BUT MOST NEW PRINTERS ARE DARKER IN COLOR. SOME PEOPLE COMPLAINED THAT IT WAS FLIMSY. I DON' FIND IT THAT WAY. IT'S SOIDLY CONSTRUCTED. I ONLY HAD IT FOR A WEEK AND ALL'S WELL SO FAR.

Title: I'm torn
Review: It seems to work ok now but the first few days were a painful. The yellow starter cartridge had leaked out in the original packaging. I had it all over me, my clothes and the counter. The next day I purchased a new yellow cartridge. I installed it and then tried to set it up. The setup failed because I wasn't using the startup cartridge. I won't bore you with the rest but getting it going was painful. However, now that we have been able to use it for the last week we really like it. Only issue now is when we try to use eprint it's hit or miss as to if it is 'found'

Title: huge step forward
Review: I had a predecessor printer from HP which is about five years old.  This one is faster, smoother and more capable.  Better in every way I can think of.  I'd have to recommend it.

Title: Great Quality Printer
Review: I've had a wide variety of printers and multi-function machines over the years at my office, and this has been the best by a wide margin. If there is any down side, it would be the size (it's simply not a compact, space-saver machine). That said, it's nothing I'd hold against it, as it does exactly what it says and I've had no issues with it at all. It is also very frugal with ink (better than many I've had in the past), and the quality of the scans is excellent (it even makes good use of the file size to generate a good quality scanned image).

Title: THIS IS THE BEST PRINTER I'VE HAD.
Review: The color is very sharp and I love the fact that it connects to the computer wirelessly.  I can have the printer in a separate location from where the computer is in case my desk is getting full.

Title: Hidden little gem of a workhorse
Review: Look up how this printer compares to all the others.  It looked to me like it was right up there in the top 3 of its class in all the various categories.  The wireless feature is so great!I don't like that you have to sign up for a snapfish account in order to use the email printing feature but it really isn't that big of a problem... one more dang password to remember.It's not the smallest in it's class, but it makes up for it's bulk with shear performance and ink conservation.

Title: Great concept low quality
Review: Looks great and read the online reviews but printing graphic documents like shown in the sample image, come out faded and streaky. Currently too busy to to try to find out if its defective or if they sent bad ink or just the product quality in general since the point of getting it was to save time. Regretting not getting the Canon now.

Title: Great AiO printer. WiFi/AirPrint huge plus.
Review: Easy setup. Connects to house WiFi so we can print from iPads, smartphones, and laptop without having to wire-connect. Large paper drawer and 2-sided printing are a plus. Has some other web features that we haven't explored/used.

Title: Excellent printer.
Review: Nice unit for the price point.Owned one before that I wore out.  Great copies, double sided.  Can buy extra large ink cartridges. Wi-fi works flawlessly.Ken in Albemarle, NC

Title: The machine works fine but the FEDEX delivery was terrible
Review: I kept looking for a delivery date which didnt show until after it was delivered. FEDEX left it on the front porch (we dont use) which is open it must have been there for three days in the rain. The outer box was soaked, lucky the inside box was not soaked. I do have a sign on the front door to deliver to the rear door.

Title: It's a complicated bipolar printer
Review: Before buying this printer, take a look to see how old some of the positive reviews are. Then google 'HP Officejet Pro 8600 won't print or scan' and you'll see a tragically long list of results. Then check out the forums with people begging for help with all sorts of advice on doing a hard restart on the modem, fiddling with printer spool resets, links to the print and scan doctor, etc. No easy answers, just links to other pages with more instructions on what you might try.So if you enjoy troubleshooting, plan to put the printer on a big lazy susan (to continually turn it around to pull off the back accessory to pull out crunched paper), don't mind wasting a monumental amount of paper and have a really high threshold for frustration - this is the 'all-in-one' printer for you!Sometimes it will print from your iPad, sometimes it won't. Sometimes it will only work with your computer. Just give yourself a couple of hours to read up on how to potentially troubleshoot the problem or simply enjoy some quiet time while on hold waiting for tech support to answer. However, if you have a Mac, please note that 24/7 support is ONLY available for Windows users. Mac users should schedule all printing problems for 'free' phone support during business hours, Monday-Friday.And if that weren't enough to tempt you, the touchpad control panel was apparently developed with technology from 2004. It's so retro. Since it hardly works, you can instead toggle through each number to get to the right letter to connect to your modem. It'll make you so nostalgic for your old flip phone. And probably for your old printer too.

Title: Great Printer
Review: I ove the wireless feature.  Works with Apple laptop, Desktop, iPad and iPhones.  Very easy to set up and use. Prints and scans very fast. Huge upgrade

Title: Excellent printer but paper difficult to load
Review: Little more than I needed here.  I haven't and probably won't hook up the FAX.  Only complaint is that the paper is somewhat difficult to load and printer is overly fussy about how it's loaded.

Title: Feature-rich printer. 2 thumbs up!
Review: First of all, let me say that the only thing that would lower my rating is if I experience the ink consummation issues others have reported. I've only had the printer a couple of days, so, I don't have a feel for that aspect yet.Out-of-the-box, the printer was very simple to set up.  Within minutes, I was printing wirelessly from my Samsung tablet (using HP's eprint app). A few minutes later, and I was able to print using HP's web services, by simply emailing an attachment to the address established and tied to my printer. Very cool.

Title: A review from a long time All-In-One user
Review: I have been a home office worker for several years.  I used the 7600 Series printer for 6 years of hard daily use and it did an excellent job with a few quirks.  It is quite clear that HP was paying attention, because those quirks are gone in the 8600 Series.  Specifically, document feeding is flawless, the paper tray has been completely redesigned and a much needed wireless feature has been added.  For the price I purchased this for on Amazon, it is a great value.If you're new to the HP All-In-One printers, they represent a nearly maintenance free printer that will give you years of great service in all the functions - printer, flat bed and sheet fed scanner, fax - they perform.  If you are a home office worker with limited tech support options, this multi-function device is an ideal choice.

Title: DOES NOT AUTOMATICALLY DUPLEX LEGAL SIZE PAPER
Review: The printer itself works fairly well. My issue with it is that, despite what they would lead you to believe based on the description, the duplexer physically does not support any paper size bigger than 8.5x11. Once I began investigating, I found numerous entries on the HP support site stating this to be the case. One example is here: [...]This is tragic as I purchased the printer specifically for auto-duplexing legal pages and this makes it useless for me. Learn from my mistake and if you need legal paper duplexing do not buy this printer.

Title: 2 months,  WORKS FOR ME !
Review: I expected problems installing, but I had none..I called H P and they talked me through it....The "wireless" thing is tricky...numbers, codes, passwords....It's quite bulky and it kind of shakes the computer cart I have it on but it's quiet and prints well.  I print from different programs, sometimes facebook and always have good results.I plan to test other paper next month and will update

Title: Great Machine
Review: I recently purchased the Pro 8600 Plus e machine after careful research of competing machines.  Set up was easy and the machine is performing as expected.  I highly recommend this machine to anyone with a small business.  The duplex faxing capabilities are great for sending double-sided forms.

Title: Same oh
Review: I've been using HP AIO's since they first came out, sticking with the devil I know mentality.  We bought this for our IPad/IPhones since the old 8500 wouldn't work with them.I encountered a MAJOR problem in set up.  I could not download the software/drivers.  I'm docking two stars for this.  That's the bad news.  The good news is HP tech support is fantastic. I called them and they just took over my computer and fixed it.  They said there was a compatibility issue between my ATT u/verse router and the printer.  It took two hours on the phone which is ridiculous, but half that was just waiting on the downloads so I didn't have stay around the whole time.One could probably argue whether it was an HP problem or an ATT problem.  Either way they fixed it.As far as setting up the "I's" for printing, there was no set up.  They take a few seconds to find the printer, and you're printing, super simple.

Title: Great home office printer
Review: I just upgraded from the model prior to this.  It does great on ink and isn't loud and is a workhorse.No issues at all and I use it networked and can print from any apple device.

Title: HP
Review: Thank you HP, I have used HP printers for sometime, but was excited to get this wireless all-in-one. It is everything I expected and more. I use my IPhone and IPad, so the wireless printing is wonderful. My copies are as good as the original, the fax works great, once I figured out which way to put the paper.I actually was able to install and get everything set up myself. So thanks again for another GREAT PRODUCT!EPH

Title: The best printer I have owned
Review: I have owned and thrown away five inkjet printers, including an Officejet, in the last 13 years. Some lasting two years some a little longer. Versions touting as photo printers never delivered truly crisp results. Ink cartridge volumes always left me wanting. Two sided printing required manual flipping without auto feeds for the scanner.I decided to take the jump up to the Officejet for what I hoped was better print quality, more features and much better durablity. Not wanting to shell out the cash for a laserjet, I had high hopes. I have  had this printer for almost two years and decided to write this review because of my experience with it.One word- excellent!Print quality is as good as a laser printer. Colors are vibrant and crisp. Graphics and pictures look like they came from the print shop. And it prints soooo fast! The volume of ink in the cartridges provides loads of prints. The XL cartridges give even more prints. Automatic two-sided prints are a snap and the auto feed does two-sided scanning like a champ.I haven't mentioned the wireless printing and scanning ability. This is the first wireless printer that has delivered flawlessly the whole time. I have to admit that I haven't even touched any of the apps built in to the touch screen (which I love), but I may.This next comment is not HP approved but unlike in the past printers, when using non-oem cartridges they sometimes didn't like them and wouldn't work. But after market ones have been working, just recognize that HP will void the warranty when thier products are not used and the ink level feature doesn't work. But the value of remanufactured cartridges makes it very palatable for me. Two XL black for $15, and I just bought a package with two black XL and a set of XL colors for $24.If you are looking for the best printer for the money, this is it. Now its even less expensive than when I bought it on sale. Considering the longevity I am getting I think this has years to go yet.

Title: Short-lived
Review: It was pretty nice while it lasted (approx. I year).  When I needed to replace the included "setup cartridges" after about a year, I spent over $100 on new (genuine, directly from HP) cartridges.  When I installed the new cartridges, the printer would not function.  I was told by HP support the print head was "bad", and that the only solution was to replace the printer.

Title: Best Inkjet I Have Ever Owned
Review: I had a really nice color laser all in one but upgraded to a Mac computer and they didn't get along.  So a shopping I went.  I did all kinds of research and looked at everything laser, inkjet, and many brands.  I decided between this and an Epson.  I went to an office chain and asked what they recommend and this is what they told me to get.I couldn't be happier with this printer!  If you are thinking about a laser because of the cost of printing being cheaper that isn't true with this printer.  The cost per page is the same as a laser, in fact it is cheaper than the color laser all in one I had.  The ink cartridges also don't dry out like they used to.  These cartridges are good for years.  I am amazed at how many pages have been printed on the setup cartridges.  I have had this since September, it is now January and I haven't replaced any cartridges yet.  I have printed a ream and a half worth of pages.  I can't wait to see how long the XL cartridges will last.It was easy to setup on both my Mac, iPad, and PC.  All of the devices installed in seconds!  One thing that really impressed me is that it automatically installs itself on Windows 8.  Print, scan, and copy quality are really good.  It is super fast at printing too.  It is nice and simple to use especially with the touch screen.  I like the duplex printing, copying, and scanning.  Trying to find a duplex scanning printer is a hard task.

Title: Easy setup and printing.
Review: Printing works great. Quick and easy setup and decent quality printing. Tried copying a colored page today using copy feature. After a half dozen color and black and white attempts to copy, I decided to just print from the file and got a good page.  The copies were crap.

Title: Love it
Review: I had one of these printers for work and loved it so much bought one for home.  Great printer.  Would totally recommend.

Title: Former HP R&D Director now an Epson customer
Review: I'm a retired Inkjet HP R&D Director. My teams developed many ink cartridges over the years. I'm proud of the underlying inkjet technology and believe that it's superior to competitor products. However, my last two All-in-One printers have failed just beyond the warranty period. The touch screen display of my 8600 failed after 15 months. It's an easy replacement - just seven screws but the replacement part is not available. My OfficeJet Pro 7600 needed a new scanner feed paper pick roller. Clearly a user replaceable part but also not available. Support told me to reboot the printer for a clearly mechanical problem - the tackiness of a roller.Like most individuals these days I print only a small amount so overall cost-per-page, where HP excels, is less important in the buying decision. Reliability is number one. HP has cheapened the designs over the years to where reliability has been compromised. Out of warranty support is nonexistent and replacement parts are not available to those of us who are handy. The bottom line is that I have sworn off HP and replaced my failed 8600 with an Epson WF-3540. It's half the price of the 8600 if you can find it on sale and it has good reliability reviews. It has twice the cost per page of the HP but if the Epson reliability is good they will earn the profits from future ink sales. HP - please note that I retired without a buyout so I'm free to speak my mind.

Title: Clunky machine
Review: Photo paper would not feed, after a long tech support call with HP, they sent a replacement. After another long support call it works but it sounds clunky. When the carriage moves it bumps and thumps.  I guess we'll keep it but whenever I print I am annoyed at the sound.

Title: Home Office HP Printer
Review: Although it uses ink like it is not on a diet, it is a very good addtion to my home office.  I would recommend it to anyone looking for a fast, easy to set up home printer.

Title: Neat features!
Review: To be able to print from anywhere, just by emailing a document to my printer (it has it's own email address) is a great feature.

Title: Great all purpose all in one device
Review: I previously purchased an HP Officejet Pro 8600 last year.  When I needed another printing device in another location I decided to purchase my second unit.  This Printer performs very well and stays connected seamlessly in my network.  Have not had any type glitches with this or the prior wireless HP Officejet Pro 8600 since I've owned them.  In the past I have had problems within my network when using wireless printers be it HP, Brother, and Dell.  Using this printer allows me to purchase and maintain on-hand the same ink cartridges,  Reduces my maintenance cost and gives my considerable confidence for printing within the network.  And, still be able to do copies, scanning, and sending of faxes without any problem.  In addition, it allows others using the network to know how to do these jobs from any of the printer locations with a minimum of effort.

Title: An EXCELLENT printer for the price!
Review: I give this printer 5 stars. I like EVERYTHING about it. For the money, you just can't beat it IMHO. It's relatively fast. It's incredibly economical, I almost can't believe how long the ink is lasting. It prints beautifully, with all kinds of options available. It scans and saves documents with every option you can think of. It faxes easily. And it copies wonderfully. The LCD display is large, making it easy to view and activate. It has wireless function. It's got flash drive and flash card slots. Document feeder works well. Honestly, for someone with SOHO, this printer is perfect............

Title: AVOID!!!!
Review: Absolute POS. HP has once again screwed their customers over, then insult their integrity even more with BS excuses as to why they do things.This printer will not, I repeat.... will NOT... print in black only, if ANY of the 3 color cartridges is empty. Why would a company produce such a STUPID software, that prevents its owners from printing in black only, when the color cartridge(s) are empty? HP 'says" it is to protect the print head and keep ink in it, so even in black printing, you are using your color cartridges, even though you dont know it, and dont want to.Save the BS excuses, HP. Ive been in the computer industry for 20yrs. Ive NEVER had a print head go bad from lack of ink... EVER! And I dont print often. Nope, this is just another way for HP to dip into your pocket, and control how you use your equipment. So, if you are in a bind and need to print a black document, but all 3 of your color cartridges go out (from HP programing their software to use color ink without your consent, even on black only print jobs) then you have to run out and spend $70 to replace your color cartridges.... just to print ONE BLACK INK ONLY PAGE!.Ill NEVER buy another HP product. The only thing they care about is the almighty dollar, and if I do have trouble... I can never talk to someone that speaks freakin English!

Title: Meets my expectations
Review: My criteria for an exceptional printer is speed, print quality, capacity and ease of operation.  The HP 8600 Plus meets all these requirements.  I especially appreciate the large and easy to use touchscreen,  the wireless access from any computer in the house and the removable papertray for easy paper loading.  I have not found anything I don't like about it.

Title: I thought it was good, but it is terrible
Review: I will stick with this from my original review: It is fast and the print quality on normal paper is very good.  The setup is extremely simple, both on the printer and when I added it to my iMac.  It also looks fantastic in the office, and the touch screen controls are easy to use.Then there are these issues:This printer has a feed problem with photo paper when you first start using it.  If you use cheaper, thin photo paper you may not have any issue.  However, the thicker paper will not get picked up by the feed, but never fear the fix is simple.  Open a blank document and print 100 pieces of paper with nothing on them.  This will break the feed wheel in enough to make it work with any paper.  I was about ready to send it back until I read this online.  I do think it is ridiculous that this needs to be done and HP doesn't make it better known.The photo print quality is terrible.  We came from a 6 year old Canon that just wasn't printing as well as it used to, and this new HP is actually ten steps backward!  The quality is terrible.  I even went and bought the HP paper (highest quality) like many internet posts mentioned, and still it is bad.  If you hold it about 6 feet away it is good, but get up close and you will see graininess and other issues that simply aren't there when it is on your computer.  We even tried going through HP customer service (which is also very terrible), thinking that there was an issue.  A print head and two replacement printers later, and it is still identically terrible.  I have now returned everything.If you don't care about picture quality, then this printer is very fast and easy to use, but I would recommend looking at a different printer.

Title: Corporate Extortion Machine
Review: This printer/fax works just fine.  BUT...it requires you to periodically buy ink cartridges and shuts down the machine until you replace the cartridges.  I never used the color ink... and still had to replace them or I couldn't use the fax...not even to send a fax or receive a black ink fax or copy.I threw it out and bought a Brother machine that didn't have this extortion feature.After having 3 HP computers, 2 laser printers, and a fax...I am done with HP.

Title: Fair value product
Review: Capable but not very fast. If on a limited data plan, wireless operation may not be the way to go. The longer scan bed allows legal size document scans.

Title: All-you-will-Ever-Need Printer
Review: When we started to print back to back pages, there were a couple of jams that we had to do some adjustments. There was nothing in the manual about fixing jams. We had to figure it out ourselves.Overall features are good, wireless connection to all three computers. Easy to operate.

Title: awesome printer
Review: This one has the most for the best price.  I searched reviews long and hard to pick this one and price wasn't really an issue within reason for a home office printer.  I have had it for a while now and I couldn't be happier with the features and printing from every device we have wirelessly.  Super!!

Title: Good Printer
Review: As a fan of HP printers, this is my third printer in the officejet series. I usually buy the dual tray setup which is the only issue I have with this printer - I like to print and then reinsert the paper to print on both sides (saves the mechanics of the printer some) and with this model the paper tray is completely covered, unlike my 7780. Otherwise, no setup problems or issues!!! Good buy.

Title: Okay ----- but
Review: I like some of the features but am disappointed in others.  My former three-in-one allowed me to print envelopes without having to remove my paper.  There are times when I need to send out a lot of correspondence.  Microsoft Word allows me to address an envelope by inserting the address from the letter to the envelope.  In order to do this, I have to remove my paper in order to print an envelope.  When I am doing seven to eight or more letters, it becomes a nuisance to unload and reload the paper tray each time.

Title: HP Office jet Pro
Review: The was for my wife one of her Christmas presents. She is very happy with the printer. It does everything she wanted and so far no problems.

Title: HIghly Recommend!
Review: I recommend this product to those who print quite often both in color or black.  The double sided printing is easy as I do not have to physically turn the paper over.  The scanning ability is easy to use and set up.  The pages print quickly for my needs. The last two printers we have used have been slow and I've had to help the double sided printing along.  At that time, we thought we were saving money, but in reality we wasted a lot on toner and ink. I am so happy to finally have a printer that I can print to without running for ink/toner every other month!

Title: Easy to set up with Win7
Review: Just spent some time setting up the 8600+ with Win7 on various machines, one via Ethernet network and the others via wireless.  All went flawlessly with no glitches or problems as is so often the case trying to get networked devices to talk to each other.  The HP scan software is simple to use and the control panel on the printer is highly functional and intuitive.  Even my iPad could print immediately via wireless (with Print 'n Share app), no muss or fuss.  It is a big unit.This is how a device should work.  Nice job, HP.

Title: Mac Worthy!!!
Review: Ok this printer is expensive (you could get more expensive, but for home use no way), but I needed a printer that could handle my ever growing collection of Apple/Mac/OS devices - from iPhones, to MacBook Pro to now my 27" iMac. My older Kodak Hero 9.1 worked with my Windows devices...but the introduction of Windows 8 has got me running quickly towards Mac/OS (hey if I wanted a touchscreen computer with crazy tiles then I'd get a tablet - oh wait I did, an iPad Air :)Ok enough about crappy Windows...back to this awesome printer! It's big, but worth the price and the functionality is great. Oh and it seamlessly hooks up to all my Apple/OS devices! I'm sure that Windows devices work just fine with this printer (although never tested), but finding an OS printer is a pain...well was a pain...not anymore!

Title: The best mutifunctional  unit there is hands down
Review: A asset to any small office even the principle uses it.  Plug and play networks almost seamlessly.Can be over stating this unit is a comfort to use.

Title: BEST PRINTER EVER
Review: This printer does everything I needed it to do. I'm a Real Estate agent and am very spoiled with the best of printers at my office. I do a lot of work from home and this does everything my fancy office printers do. I love the fact that I can scan a contract and email it directly to clients without having to save it to my computer first.

Title: Love it, except . . . Good piece of office equipment . . .  but . . .
Review: Okay - I used to have a home office, and I really liked how well this thing does wireless, has a pretty good scanner, prints good quality stuff and all but it was designed so that even if you want to print everything in black, when your yellow or any other color is running low, it will not print.  There is no bypass.  There is no workaround.  There is no way to put a filler in so you can hit that last minute deadline.  You have to pay them extra to keep another yellow cartridge around even when you don't want to do so.  I found this to be extremely aggravating.  Enough so that in a heat of passion I desired to give it one star.  This one error makes less worthy than its competition for an upstart company on a shoestring with tight margins.  This printer will drive your office costs up in an unreasonable way due to how they stick you on the ink.  What's more, their employees are extremely arrogant about it.  I probably wouldn't even be adding this lovely bit of feedback to the internet, except that when I was searching the net for a workaround, I read the comment of one of HP's employees arrogantly talking about how there is no workaround and why their product is superior - essentially inviting the beknighted soul who was up against a deadline to go sit on a tack.  I would like to tell HP that if it were my consultant, I would stop hiring it.  If it were my employee, it would be the first on the chopping block when times got tough, and should it fall to its competitors, I will not be sympathetic.  If you buy this printer, you'll be very happy with it, except for the ink thing. It's one of those products designed to save you from yourself.  It's like a car telling you that you should stop driving be cause the highway is bumpy.

Title: Better than N911A
Review: I used to have the OfficeJet Pro 8600 and it does not print anymore since I moved the printer across the country without removing the cartridges ahead of time.I was very satisfied by the 8600 (N9100a) but decided to replace it with the 8600 Plus (N911g) as the g can scan in duplex, which is convenient. The bigger screen is nice but unnecessary. However the space where the feeder ejects the paper is much more accessible with the 9 than with the a.This printer also has a web interface, which makes the setting very easy. The printer is also ChromeBook ready and although not straightforward to set up, we have a Mac, Windows8 and a Chrome all sharing the printer. Lastly, I also like that you can scan a paper and email it to me - without needing to even use a computer to scan.Overall it meets my needs of a business professional and home printer.

Title: Quality, What Else Can I Say!
Review: I have been buying Hewlett Packard Printers, Since 2000, and have had excellent service from them. I still have two OfficeJet printers that were purchased beginning in 2003 that still work. The reason I bought this one, was all the new features and the dependability I've had with the other Hewlett Packard printers I've owned.

Title: HP Pro 8600 printer
Review: Love the e-print capability. Works flawlessly. Wouldn't have anything but an HP Printer. I like the multple inks y-m-c-and black for more cost effective changes.

Title: HP 8600 Plus
Review: Scans quickly. Quiet and footprint smaller than my HP7500. Prints fast but slow to start printing. Everything else works beautifully

Title: The E-Print function was useful, and it did work as a wired network ...
Review: I did not buy this printer at Amazon, but at C***co. It lasted exactly six months beyond the one year warranty period. It spent its entire service life plugged into an uninterruptable power supply- so it never saw a surge or a brownout. Other gear plugged into the same UPS, including an Epson printer, a desktop, and a monitor, still works. Wireless never worked properly due to the fact that a wireless request would not bring the unit online, and it tended to lose it's ip address because it would stop transmitting- causing the wireless router to give it a new address every time it came back up. The E-Print function was useful, and it did work as a wired network printer- but the cartridges did not last as long as I anticipated (burned ink every time you had to recycle power to clear one of the not infrequent "hangs"). It had some great features: the entire print head assembly is easily removed and replaced. It had an integral duplexer that allows two-sided printing. The software allowed it to detect multiple computers in a wired network and choose the destination for a scan manually accomplished at the printer- and the print quality remained good until it stopped due to an illusory "paper jam" issue. I dug into this to find out exactly why it thought a jam existed; It was a failed sensor near the paper tray reporting an obstruction due to a bad photodiode which no longer transmits (I have a technical background which often allows me to fix things to component level). This part is in a chunk of cast plastic- and not easily replaced. The cost of repair would exceed the current value of the machine. I used to love HP... until the likes of Carly Fiorina got their hooks into it, HP gear was very solid indeed. If you can afford to replace your printer every 18 months, feel free to buy this unit- otherwise, I advise against it. The company is no longer under the families which raised it to such prominence- and it shows.

Title: SO FAR SO GOOD
Review: I PURCHASED TWO OF THESE AS GIFTS ONLY ONE HAS BEEN INSTALLED AND IT SEEMS TO BE WORKING AS ADVERTISED.

Title: Poor design and quality
Review: Bad machine for home office use, horrible for loading various sheets... changing from one type of paper to another is a real chore... also, it frequently double-feeds paper.  It might be OK compared to others on the market, but come on HP, hire even one person to test stuff before you make it and sell it, please!?

Title: Amazing Technology
Review: This printer was my first new printer in 10 years. I am amazed at the features such as fax, copy and scan as well as print. All at a price just 1/8 of the amount I paid for my old printer.  I love this new technology.

Title: Incomplete purchase
Review: I received the machine but never received the warranty papers I paid extra for! How do I get this sent to me?

Title: Great Printer Less Ink!
Review: I have been very pleased with my HP Pro 8600 printer.  I have used it for several months and it works well.  Ink consumption is much less than my previous HP printer, and quality of printing excellent.  Wireless connections have been stable and reliable with only a couple of times that I have needed to reboot.  I recommend this printer for in home or small business use!

Title: Excellent Full Featured work machine
Review: Great features though difficult to set up. Excellent support from HP to help the process. Scanning to e-mail was tricky.

Title: Excellent product with one slight annoyance
Review: Excellent product and lives up to press, however, it lost a star due to the inordinately lound noise when printing.

Title: Gr8 printer for moderate use
Review: Gr8 printer but manual paper feed for envelopes and scan that can zoom would be nice improvements.  Wireless feature easy to setup so tablets, iPods and laptops can print

Title: Decent all in one printer/scan/fax.
Review: So far, so good. It is a good product design. Set-up with the e-print and wireless is tedious. And perhaps unnecessary.That will be helpful in printing from a phone or tablet.Verdict is out on longevity and quality.I ordered the 2-year extra protection plan for insurance, based on reviews.

Title: LOVE IT!
Review: I really do LOVE IT! The touch screen makes it easier to make choices.  Getting wifi connection initially was simple and successful.  I'm now having some difficulties connecting with the same devices that once worked with the printer.  Looks like I'll have to hit a "Help" section to get back on track.  BUT, glad I purchased the printer.

Title: Go wireless printing!
Review: Being able to print from any of my devices is just incredible!  The mobile app on the iPhone sometimes takes a while to see the printer, though.  If t wasn't for that and for some "scary" noises the printer makes whee warning up, I would give it five stars.

Title: Wireless Nightmare
Review: Never have I dealt with a less reliable wireless device.  If you intend to use this as a part of your wireless network, after countless struggles, I strongly suggest going with another brand.  I've wasted countless hours on this and I'm rather experienced with networks.

Title: Warning - will not print borderless photos!
Review: Does the job for all functions - but if you are a photographer, buy a different printer.  I am not impressed with the output from this machine, and the printing options are slim.  To release a printer in this day and age that will not print borderless photos is really questionable.

Title: Horribly slow poster printing and extremely poor quality
Review: I just finished setting up this printer (very easy!). I printed my first document. It was a densely colored poster. I used the same paper I've used in other HP printers - that printed the same poster beautifully. This was EXTREMELY SLOW - 4 minutes for 8 1/2 x 11 page and the paper came out wrinkled. I have to take this back. It will not work at all. Very slow, very poor quality. Very disappointed. I only gave it the 2nd star because of ease of set up. A complete waste of paper and ink. Taking it back now.

Title: HP is good for your print jobs
Review: HP in my opinion takes the cake when it comes to printer performance especially when quality is king and this printer ink takes first place in its category for unadulterated performance concerning its use especially when it comes to color prints, magnificent color output the printer  works smooth, trays are easily changed to accommodate paper sizes. I am satisfied that HP did a good job when it constructed this 8600 and I am a satisfied use. HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One Wireless Color Printer is the best at its price.

Title: HP Pro Officejet 8600 Plus All in one printer
Review: This printer is amazing & does everything including double 2 sided copying & printing along with wirelessInternet print jobs ! Scanner works great along with fax & photo quality is excellent even on multifunctionbright paper by HP! Best part is yet to come , the ink usage is the best I have seen in years , & I connotforget the larger touch screen which makes print jobs so easy !

Title: Falls way short of expectations for an office printer.
Review: What crummy printer!  I have a home office and do a lot of printing and scanning.  I've had this printer for close to a year and it has been a constant irritation since purchase.  The print quality is great but with today's technology a $99 print would do just as well.  My issues are simple: 1) the scanning mechanism is horribly noisy in duplex mode & can't scan in duplex unless the sheets are standard or legal size sheets.  Additionally anything that is an 'odd' size needs to be scanned on the glass plate instead of the ADF.  2)  We do a lot of printing in our home office but we only do it once or twice a week.  The print head/nozzle on this machine is ALWAYS clogged and ALWAYS needs cleaning which waste paper & ink.  If you don't print daily don't buy this unit!  Lastly, to save money we purchase none HP ink cartridges and the printer politely reminds us of that regularly.  It would be really great is a company like HP could produce a consumer friendly product that works well instead of designing their machines to maximize their profits.In closing my previous printer, a Canon MP530, was fantastic with none of these issues and we used it even less.  The only reason for replacing it was that the scanning mechanism had gone out after 5 years of great service.

Title: Great Buy
Review: One and a half years later, this unit continues to do me solid. Would recommend to any home office or small business.

Title: If you have non continuous printing then the print cost per sheet will be very high.
Review: All functions are excellent.  No miscues.  Excellent quality printing.  My only complaint is ink usage.  I bought based on Consumer Reports on ink usage and price.  The surprise was on a later Consumer Report article on high ink usage on initial startup and clean when complete.  It was something not included in their original review.  I was noticing all the activity of the printer at the begging and the end of printing.  If you have non continuous printing then the print cost per sheet will be very high.  I would recommend for hone and office use.

Title: You can't use it without wasting HUNDREDS of dollars on needles ink purchases
Review: This device is crippled by a simple scam: The printer will not print Black-And-White/gray without non-empty color ink. And, it uses some color ink on EVERY job, regardless if it is B&W or not (wasteful), which means that when you need more black ink, you will have to buy color ink, meaning that you will flush HUNDREDS of dollars down the drain on this printer.So, it will waste color ink on a black-and-white job, when no color is needed. Interestingly, though, when it is out of black ink, it will happily allow you to print in a dark greenish color using color ink, which of course depletes the ink in 1 or 2 jobs. This alone puts the lie to this behavior.Scam. Avoid.

Title: Excellent Printer
Review: This printer is absolutely awesome, the speed, so easy to set up, the wireless works perfect with an iPad.  Recommend this highly.

Title: Excellent for over a year
Review: Ive had this printer for over a year and it still works great for all functions, print, copy, and fax. The top tray can feed unevenly is the only drawback if overloaded only.

Title: Useless with Windows XP, appalling tech support.
Review: Do not bother if you are still using Windows XP, or if you think you may need any kind of tech support. I installed the XP drivers supplied on the included CD. The printing is extremely slow, I mean 15 mns for a one page color PDF file, 10 mns before you see the first page of a 15 pages Word document with pictures. Following a tip on the Web, I install instead XP drivers for a HP Deskjet 990c and printing is almost instantaneous. So the printer may work great but the drivers are worthless. Tech support over the phone? Forget it. It's someone in India and the static on the line is so bad you can't hear anything and they can't hear you. Tech support through on line chat? You first have to submit the serial number and model number to verify that it's still under warranty. I purchased the printer a week ago so there should be no problems, right? Wrong. The answer comes back, the warranty expired a year ago! I am returning the printer and won't buy another HP product, thank you very much.

Title: Excellent and will buy from the seller again.
Review: Excellent and works very well.  Love it.  No issues.  Wireless printing makes job easier with multiple computers and printout from any computer.  If it has wireless issues, reboot the printer and connection works.

Title: Why bother buying some other mediocre wireless home printer?
Review: This HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e- All-in-One wireless printer is just about the best printer I've had.It is extremely efficient & printer ink lasts forever.It has options & on-screen menus for every task and home use function that I've needed & used.It is very quiet, fast, and practically uses very little ink.

Title: HP 8600 Plus Problems
Review: I am having problems with my HP Officejet 8600 Plus. The paper is being folded in the upper corner and the print is not straight on the sheet of paper. Will have to return to Amazon or send to HP for possible repairs which shouldn't be necessary with a brand new printer.

Title: Air print great. Wireless NP
Review: I've used this model at work. We work them hard and no problems. The ink cartridges last a long time.

Title: Very nice printer with a lot of features
Review: Set up was easy and wireless connection installed without any problem.  Makes impressive color copies . After a month of ownership we are pleased with our purchase at this point

Title: Nice printer
Review: Setup was a bit tricky compared to my 8500.  I wish the ink cartridges weren't so expensive.  That's where they get you.

Title: WON'T PRINT ON CARDSTOCK
Review: There is clearly a design flaw with this printer. If you check the HP forum, there are some crazy things you can do to try to get it to print, but for me, in continues to be a problem.  I should not have to fuss with my printer for an hour to get it to print a single page of card stock. Very disappointed.

Title: so far working well.
Review: A bit noisy when pulling the paper through.  Almost sounds like it's going to jam.  But print is clear - color's are good for pictures.

Title: I thought this printer was great... until I discovered serious flaws.
Review: 1. You cannot print in B&W unless all the color cartridges are full. This is horrible. If one color goes dry, your printer doesn't work.2. Each time you remove or replace a cartridge, it sucks out 10% of the ink in all of your cartridges for an "initialization" process. My Cyan ($35) went dry so my printer was useless. I had plenty of black and at least 10% left in the other colors but the printer wouldn't even allow me to print in grey scale. I bought a replacement cyan but the process of replacing it sucked the magenta ($35) and yellow ($35) dry. I then replaced those one-at-a-time, which sucked the black dry ($35) too. When I started, I had plenty of black ink all I had wanted to do was print a b&w business document. It cost me over $100 just to restore minimum functionality to my 'printer'. I will do better research in the future. This was underhanded on the part of HP to maintain their flow of ink sales and I will not purchase any more of their products.

Title: Don't buy it
Review: This printer works most of the time.It will have problems with the network, which is frustrating.  I have had to reset my network and at times uninstall and reinstall the drivers on my computer, which I've never had to do with other printers.Also INCREDIBLY annoying, is that if one of your color cartridges runs out, you can't print from the black cartridge only.  SO AGGRAVATING.  I don't think I would buy this printer again.

Title: Dont buy for Photos!!!!!!!!!!!!
Review: I am giving it a second star only because it prints well on regular paper. That being said....if you want to print photos you are better off throwing it out the window and getting another printer. It will not feed photo paper of any real thickness and quality and when it does will leave marks and a crease where it grips. This thing is a photo nightmare. I am not a business and just wanted a photo printer to make some pictures for others and to hang around the house and what I have is totally and utterly useless. Waste of money in my book.

Title: Fast & easy Setup
Review: I received this yesterday afternoon and had it up and running on a window 8.1 machine in less than I hour after unpacking - I connected it to my wired network and tele line before turning it- Then I added  the included ink carts. That allowed the printer to grab a IP address (DCHP) from my router. it assigned a hp Email address (WHICH) you can change after you install the Software Disk (included) on your PC Doing it in that order will get it reg with HP site faster. once that's out of the way -on to the HPeprint site - using the printers email address from your mart phone you can print from your device anything you can email to your printer if you need that -THe software can then be added to any other PC running WIN7 AS well - Very happy so far!

Title: greatest thing I have purhased in a long time.
Review: The best product I have bought in awhile. Will let all my friends know. Love it. Will definetly suggest it to all.

Title: The new standard of all-in-one printers
Review: well, i think 4 months of heavy work load is enough to review this printer from HP, my experience with HP printers has never been good, but that is about to change.Why i choose this  printer?===========================the reasons i bought this printer for are:1- Double sided scan from ADF (Automatic Document Feeder).2- Home Office oriented.3- Wireless printing.but i was surprised by a ton of features that hit my like a truck :)this printer has/can:=================1- embedded Web server:every single option/control in this printer can be done remotely via the EWS, thus, i never use the touch screen panel (except for setting up my networking in the first place), beside that; you can scan via that EWS, just put your paper on the ADF and trigger the web scan feature, the scanned documents will be available for download from virtually any device that has an access to the printer, the EWS is one of the biggest surprises about this printer, open your browser and point to http://PRINTER'S_IP/ and take a look at the EWS.2- scan and send via email:you can configure your personal Gmail account with this printer and it will send your scans directly to the configured email address.3- scan to network shared folder / USB Stick / Memory cards:and it is doing it with excellence.4- full internet based solution (eprint):when registering your printer with HP's eprint website, they will setup an email address for your printer, simply, when sending mails to that mail address the printer will print it automatically!, of course, you can restrict the email addresses that can send an email to your printer, how handy is that?!5- mini-market:despite the fact that the printer can update its firmware over-the-air, the printer has a number of free and paid applications that you can install and schedule so the application will print its output according to the time table (or upon request), i have some interesting apps already like 'Origami', 'DreamWorks' and 'Angry Birds' (for the kids coloring), 'Comics To Do' it will print a todo list in the morning which i fill (yes, i can do that on my mobile but i am of 'thinking while writing' kind of people, 'Google Docs' integration and a lot more.i have to say that i have used this printer as a scanner more than a printer, i printed about 800 pages with 0 jams and scanned about 2000 pages with 14 jams, that is 0.7 percentage (and actually the all the jam were because of crumbled papers)what is bad?============this printer should not be used to print photos, it is really not up to the standard, comparing it with the other low end Canon printer that i have puts this printer to shame, however, this is not what i bought it for and that is the reason i didn't lower the review to 4 stars.Basically, i am happy with this printer, i have used every feature mentioned above, if not for need then for fun, knowing that you have this feature or that one will turn the fun into a need sometime in the near future.i will update my review after i replace my first set of cartridges.Thanks!

Title: Home perfect.
Review: It does all it claims to. One of the best all in one printers I have invested in for the price.

Title: Great Printer for a Home Office
Review: Pros: Very easy setup. Good print quality. Good speed. Good on toner cost.Cons: Printing on thick paper is nearly impossible. Drops from wireless network during sleep mode. Opens your wireless network to security problems.Biggest frustration is printing on thick paper. I've tried HP and user recommendations. I've printed 1000's of pages and the rollers still do not work well with thick paper. Beyond the thick paper and opening your wireless network up for attack, this printer is fantastic. I'm seeing consistently good quality prints and my toner cost has dropped dramatically. The HP Officejet Pro 8600 is nearly perfect for any home office.

Title: Nice and sturdy printer. Office quality.
Review: Nice printer and it does the job. We use it as a network printer at home and it fills the bill. Have not tried e-printing and probably won't... no real need for it. Let's Go Red Wings!

Title: Hate All HP Printers. This One is one of the Worst.
Review: After the first set of cartridges, the printer heads would need constant cleaning. Bought another set of HP carts and heads started to bleed all over paper. This is the forth HP printer I've had in four years. Meanwhile, I have three Epson printers that are several years old and are all working beautifully. It seems that HP printers have planned obsolescence and their Support is terrible.Evidently, customer satisfaction and product quality consistency  is not HP's priority if you read some of the other 1 star reviews.Why did I buy this printer? Why? Why! saw it at COSTCO on sale. Should have my head examined.

Title: Caution regarding HP Officejet Pro 8600 laser printer
Review: We purchased this printer from a different vendor.  Paid a professional IT service man to come and install it on our small company wireless network.There was trouble from the start because once it went to power-saver mode (sleep), it dropped off the wireless, will not respond, menu screen was frozen, would not power off, must be unplugged to recover.  HP support required us to take it off surge protector.  Firmware was upgraded, to no avail.  (I think a firmware bug is the real problem).  Searching support sites revealed over 22000 hits on this issue.  HP will not address the issue, said to take it back where purchased.Today we returned it, and the vendor made a full refund plus refunded the cost of the extended warranty and maintenance contract, even though we were a few days beyond their return period.

Title: Quality printer
Review: Good printer, many features...  Hope it lasts longer than the previous one (print head malfunctioned within warranty period).  Thank you

Title: NEVER Again will I purchase an HP printer!
Review: This printer just stopped working after owning it for less than 6 months and using it probably a dozen times in total. Just stopped.  I would get a message that appeared on the printer screen saying everything from "There is a paper jam" to  "The ink cartridge is not moving" to "Unable to print, turn the printer off for 10 seconds and then on again - If problem persists contact HP"- It was as if the printer didn't even know what the problem was.When I called HP and finally got through all those different prompts on the phone to actually speak to a technician, and after explaining the problem, he (the Tech) told me that there was nothing that could be done and that it couldn't be repaired or replaced and I would have to buy a new one.  And that was that.  Could nothing be done I asked?  At all?  The Technician explained to me that I could get another HP for $25 less with a coupon he could provide.  I was struck dumb. He was actually trying to sell me a new HP printer!  Like that would happen again! They also don't tell you that they charge you $25 just to speak to the technician - I didn't find this out until he told me he would credit the $25 fee on my credit card (on file) because there had been no resolution to the problem.Customer service was/is horrible.  My next printer will be a Brother or an Epson or a Dell or anything that's not HP.Lastly -  the technician couldn't even provide me with an address, phone number or an email so that I can write a complaint. It was crazy NEVER again!John L.

Title: Cartridge Scam
Review: So the printer itself is quite good but given the SCAM of requiring some colour cartridge ink I would urge whoever is going to buy this to reconsider.  Basically if even one of the colour cartridges runs out of ink, the printer is useless and cannot print.  So your yellow runs out and every other ink is full and you cannot print any black pages.Also, please read reviews for the cartridges which are quite expensive and often refilled.  This does NOT have a low cost per page.  I am extremely disappointed in HP and will likely never buy a product from them again.  I have had this printer for over 1.5 years.

Title: Office at Home
Review: Simple to set up unit and wireless connection.  Operation is easy, prints quickly and fairly quiet.  My biggest complaint is the software for the unit. I run the unit in draft mode as default and change setting only when I need.  To change the setting is too cumbersome requiring 4+ clicks (old Canon software was much better).

Title: A Really Good Machine
Review: Right after my HP C309a all-in-one quit working, I immediately started researching similar machines.After looking at reviews and comparing specs, I decided on the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One.  More and more, its looking like I made the right decision. I'm loving this machine.

Title: WONT BUY THIS PRODUCT ON LINE
Review: I wont buy this type of item anymore on lineIt stoppred working and I am stuck with itI will buy from local vendor,in future, at least I could bring it back for them to fix

Title: Disapointed in HP
Review: Purchased this printer with the promise of "50% lower cost per (printed) page". Seemed like a good excuse to replace my printer since this model can be networked and by using HP ePrint, the promise to "print from virtually anywhere". Unfortunately, in this mode, printing does not include printing photos (photos printing via the USB interface does work however).The second major complaint is the omission of a Twain driver for scanning. This seems inexplicable given the implied use of the printer in an office environment. Fortunately there are 3rd party Twain solutions that work just fine like VueScan.Whats up HP? Do inclusion of these features, supplied on earlier HP printer models, interfere with your current business model?

Title: HP All in One
Review: Im not a big fan of HP products. You have to use there ink or printer wont work and the are designed to last a year. 2 at most anf I just threw away 110.00 worth of ink I just put in the one that went bad and it wont fit my new one. Wish you could find out more about some other brands

Title: Poor Connectivity
Review: The HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus is an average printer overall if it were not for one fatal flaw.  The connectivity firmware built into this printer is flawed.  I use my 8600 with an Ethernet connection and this printer loses it connection to the router (and therefore all devices on my home network) about once every two to three days.  I have spent hours on the telephone with HP support and their final solution was to sell me a new 8600 printer at a cost higher than the original price I paid.  I have always had good luck with HP printers but I am worried that this is a sign of a downward trend in quality.

Title: do not buy
Review: This printers touch screen broke. The display was impossible to read, this is a common fault. HP said they would replace it and then changed their mind 10 mins later. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.

Title: beware of running out of color ink
Review: Beware!  As per HP's own admission, this printer will become inoperable in black and white, if any of the color cartridges (which cost $30 each) start running low!)!!!It is a cash machine for HP, and nothing more.  [...]

Title: A lot of Printer packed into one unit
Review: I've used this printer at my work office for a year now and like it so much I purchased one for the home office.  The unit is packed with features that are easily accessable on the front LCD touchscreen.  The 8600 base model has a small touch screen, but I find the larger screen much easier to work with.  The printer is very fast and makes very clean copies.  I've had not issues with the document feeder like I've had with other models in the past.  Documents flow in and out freely even if they are a reciept taped to a piece of copy paper.  The flat bed can scan a legal document which is also something that is harder to find in an economical desktop unit.  Add double sided copying or scanning and you have all the functionality of a large copier.  The connectivity couldn't be better either as it can connection via LAN, WAN, or USB to any computer on your network.  With internet access you can also use built in extras like templates or HP's ePrint application that lets you print from any tablet or phone no matter where you are.  Overall, I love this printer.

Title: Best printer ever!
Review: I've been reading negative reviews and just had to say that this is the best printer I ever had. I've had it for a couple years now and love it. I used to have a huge heavy duty, expensive laser one that went out all the time and cost $400 a pop to fix. I finally decided to cut my losses and get this one. What a lifesaver! This one was a snap to set up from the get go, plus I've never had any problems at all. It's easy to install new ink cartridges, and the document feeder and copy functions work brilliantly on mine. The scanner works great - you can set it to scan in various formats too for email, pdf or computer file and it automatically pops up on your computer screen with no guessing needed. I can even print from another room off my iPhone when necessary because of the wireless setup. I got the version that allows 11' x 14' printing and I don't use it often, but I'm glad it's there when I need it. Just wanted to let you know that if you're reading the reviews, not all of us have had the same problems. I recommend this highly. I bought it for over $250 and see the price is lots better now. I'd still pay $250 and be happy.

Title: A very good inkjet printer
Review: I read many reviews prior to purchasing the Officejet Pro 8600 from many of the industry publications and found this printer to fit my needs of a home office. I am very pleased with the purchase but I don't like the many clunking noises that it makes. I realize that it is not a laser printer, even though it prints almost as good as one. I'm not sure if I would recommend it yet or not.

Title: Nice Printer
Review: It's been working as expected.  I haven't printed any pictures but word doc and spreadsheet printing is clear.  Scanning hand writing is good too.

Title: Good printer
Review: I was debating between getting the Canon PIXMA MG6320 and this HP Officejet 8600 Pro Plus, I decided on the latter one because of 3 reasons: 1) The paper tray holds more paper, 2) Ink costs cheaper than the ink for the Canon, 3) Quality of documents and pictures is as good as Canon's, 4) Printing doesn't hog ink as the Canon would.  For now I am happy with this printer.

Title: Last HP Product I buy!
Review: I wanted a wireless AIO and decided to go with inkjet over laser because of cost of toner.  This printer has 3 MAJOR shortcomings - 1) print quality is sub par, nowhere near laser quality or even near the quality of my other inkjet.  2) There is no envelope feeder so you have to remove the paper from the tray, adjust the tray insert etc just to print an envelope.  I thought this is an 'office' product?  3) I get a line down the middle of all my copies.  Doesn't appear on scans or print jobs, just copies.

Title: BUYER BEWARE
Review: This is the second unit in one year that I purchased on Amazon  the first unit lasted almost a year this unit made it 3 months.HP = HORRIBLE PRODUCT !

Title: The HP Officejet is a real pro for a small home office like our own.
Review: Printing  is fast and is of high quality with very good double sided printing. The touch screen is very easy to use. The  scan and document send performs very well too.

Title: Printhead failure 1 month after warranty!
Review: I had to replace the magenta cartridge but when I went to the store I bought the color pack of magenta, yellow, and cyan together for $60 thinking I will need to replace yellow and cyan at some point down the road. As soon as I replace magenta, the printer said it was out of yellow. I replaced yellow, the printer said it was out of cyan. I replaced cyan, the printer said it was out of black. Back to the store I go...for $40 I buy the black cartridge. Now I have spend over $100 bucks to replace every cartridge...but the printer still wont print. After troubleshooting on my own to no avail, I contact HP support. They tell me it is a hardware issue (print head failure!) and the printer is out of warranty (by one month).
