Title: HP Officejet 8600
Review: The printer is very easy to install. I like that the scanner bed allows for legal size paper, and that it has two sizes (regular and XL cartridges). I like to use the XL cartridges so I don't have to change the ink cartridges as often.The only "negative" comment is that the FAX speed dial - which I used a lot - only allows for scrolling thru the list and there is no faster alternative as with the HP 8500, but am getting used to it - so it bothers me less and less

Title: like my 8500 better....
Review: my ADF on my 8500 wireless unit went bad, so I made the decision to buy a new all in one instead of paying a technician to come out and fix my ADF on my 8500....I can't believe the differences in the 2 units....1st - the unit I got is chocolate brown which I hate, I could have swore the one in the store was black but mine is not....2nd - I like my 8500 touch screen better because it is larger and it is a nice touchscreen material...I have to use a touchscreen pen with my 8600 in order to print/copy/etc.3rd - my 8500 had a number keypad like on a keyboard that was easy to use for faxing, but the 8600 is touchscreen and a pain to use....4th - the ADF tray on the 8600 is flat, completely parallel with the tray that catches the paper after it feeds through the ADF, the tray on the 8500 was on an angle which made it easy to collect documents after feeding through the ADF5th - the tray that collects the newly printed pages cannot lift up on the 8600, it is fixed, so in order to refill the paper tray, you have to close the top tray and pull the bottom tray out, the 8500 lifted up which was much more convenient....I'm considering writing to HP to see if I can return this one and get my old one fixed, I like the 8500 that much better...the print quality and features of the 8600 are great, my only complaints are the ones listed above which I unfortunately have to deal with on a daily basis!

Title: This printer surprised us
Review: This Pro 8600 is really impressing us.  It responds quickly, prints automatically, also quickly.  Scan and copy  both have previews that allow manual adjustments.  I have printed from my i-Phone, and pad also.  Printed six or seven color photos too, they were beautiful  8x10.  Very nice machineBut..... when are they going to make one  (or an App)  that allows them to fax through our cell phones.  This printer can fax, but I don't have a land line.

Title: Wireless
Review: We finally got a wireless printer! Works great, only thing is that it is a SLOW printer. I thought it would print a lot faster, but no such luck.

Title: Fax stopped working
Review: I bought this machine about six weeks ago and it worked pretty well until a few days ago, then the fax component stopped. Dealing with the HP tech support was an absolute nightmare with repeated calls and each new tech making you go through the same maddening checklist. FINALLY got someone who knew what they were doing and they will replace it because of some modem malfunction in the fax part. I even had to pay for the phone company to come out and check the line (which is a dedicated line specifically for the fax) even though I insisted that we plugged in my regular phone and it worked perfectly. It was still under warranty but I will only get a 'refurbished' replacement that they said 'should work like new.' The phone guy said not to plug the phone line from the machine back into the line because it might damage the line. However, the tech and tech supervisors refused to replace the machine until they performed the exact steps the prior techs performed and said they were sorry but could not pay for another service call as well. What a joke!!!!! Two service calls equals the price of a new machine and now I get a 'refurbished' machine for all of my expense and trouble. I hope this is only a fluke thing, but you should be aware of how hard it is to deal with tech support with issues with your machine.

Title: Great printer!
Review: I have used many different HP printers and this has exceeded all the others thus far.  I really like the onscreen touchpad and the ease of use.  It has the capability of double-siding, which is pretty cool.  One thing that may be a downside is the cost of ink.  Will have to see how this weighs out with my older HP's.  It came with a trial pack, and so far I've printed off a ream of paper (500 pages)... and I also use the fast or draft mode to save on ink too.  I also like the wireless option with my various computers on the network.  And you can print from your smart phone.  So, a pretty decent printer!

Title: First wireless printer...I love that capability
Review: I have had dozens of printers over the years but never a wireless one. This printer is great. Very easy to set up and it prints very fast with very good quality. It also is very reasonable on the ink needed for it's printing jobs for the cost seems much lower to print/job than many other printers I have had.It is a bit bigger than some of the others but I will live with this for all the great wireless printing it gives me. .

Title: Great home office multifunction.
Review: I bought this for my home office and it is great.  Set up was easy as long as you follow the instructions.  I lost connectivity twice and resolved it by cycling the power on my wireless router or on the printer.  Otherwise it meets all of the requirements I had for a multifunction in my home office.

Title: Awesome Multi-tasker!
Review: I had heard some cautionary remarks about HP and how they weren't that easy to set up and use and that it was becoming an older model. A great price, what the printer said it could do, and some positive review research made me decide to give it a go.  I am very happy I did!  I easily set it up for wireless printing for my PC, iPad and Windows Surface table PC. Hard wired printing is faster, and another option. Being able to fax, scan and copy are great. The auxiliary USB and SDHC ports are very useful.  The ink has lasted very well, and replacement ink is the cheapest of all the major brands.  I wouldn't hesitate to purchase it again or recommend it!

Title: Great Results
Review: I found the printer to work exceptionally well and believe this was a good purchase for the price.  It is not the fastest printer out there, but the quality of print is very good.

Title: My last HP Product
Review: This is the absolute worst printer that I have ever owned.  It has had serious paper feed problems from day 1.  I will never another HP product.

Title: Super Product
Review: Came as promised.  This is a fantastic product for this price.  Don't wait any longer purchase yours today.5 + Stars for me!

Title: Great multifunction printer
Review: Fast printing, quality is OK but not as great as with my DeskJet 5740, but good enough. Large individual cartridges.Definitely one of my favorite functionality is Scan-to-email and Print-to-email. No need to install the full HP software suite on your computer to benefit from the scanning function; all you need is a ISP-provided email account, and you will use their SMTP server to email to yourself documents that you scan, just like you would on a $15,000 copier.Touch screen is nice, not the fastest, but functional enough to use for regular tasks.WiFi setup can be troublesome, but most of the time, manually entering the SSID instead of selecting it from the list solves the problem.Hefty size, but considering it is wireless, you don't need to have it right next to your computer.

Title: Missing Power Cord!!!
Review: Paid for one day shipping because I desperately needed a new printer and when it arrived there was no power cord!  Now I'm going to have to jump through hoops and wait forever to remedy this issue.  I will update this review, after the drama ensues.

Title: Office Jet Pro 8600
Review: This compact all in one is a great machine.  It is sturdy and its size is perfect for the office.  I highly recommend it.

Title: Piece of crap....suddenly craps out and all lights flash
Review: Began having connection issues after 6 mos. Suddenly shows and error and all lights flash. Tried resetting, changed modems, changed wireless settings. Very expensive piece of crap. I researched with Consumer Reports, amazon, ebay, ect. and this printer got high ratings. I am VERY disappointed. Guess i'll skip the reviews for the replacement and toss the dice. Don't waste your money.

Title: GOOD PRODUCT
Review: It is a very impressive printer.....a few less options would be desireable but overall a nice unit with excellent print quality.

Title: Great Printer
Review: I have using this brand for long time, but this new printer is the best of the best I'm glad to have it.

Title: Cannot print at all when one ink cartridge runs out
Review: I am very disappointed to find out that this printer 'is engineered to stop functioning and request ink when a cartridge is low' (per HP support).  You cannot print in black and white nor in greyscale.  When you run out of just one color cartridge you are dead in the water until you buy a new one.What is even worse is the user's guide says you CAN print in greyscale when a cartridge is out.  This was a VERY IMPORTANT point in my buying decision since I mostly print black and white.  However after going through the HP support forums it is now very obvious the user guide is intentionally misleading and incorrect.Very poor engineering decision IMHO.

Title: Awsome Printer
Review: I have 3 of these at work and one at home.  I haven't had any issues at all.  I have been looking for a printer like this for a long time.Very Happy!!

Title: Love it
Review: I'm an attorney with a small office so, wanted a compact printer that would do it all. This HP is amazing. Print, copy and scanning qualities are great and fast. I had a Brother 5445-CN and this printer blows it away. I haven't tried printing envelopes or fax (as I use efax), but hoping the quality and efficiency will be on the same level.  Will try the wireless feature for my MACbook in the next couple of weeks and will provide an update.

Title: Good, but no better than 8500 Officejet Pro
Review: If I could get a new 8500 Pro series, which has given us over 96,000 full prints thus far, only on its second print head - I would trade in my new 8600 Pro Plus hands down. We still use our 8500 Pro and love it more than our 8600 so far.This review is to add some insight into the networking issues with the new 8600 series. We are an all apple computer office, with exception to our router being linksys e4000. If we have to power down our router, the 8600 printer all the sudden starts going super slow motion, in that 10 prints in the que will take anywhere from 10 minutes to an hour to print. This is definitely an HP issue with networking and mac computers. To resolve this issue, we have to shut off the HP 8600, remove the printer on each machine, power back on the printer, then read it to each computer. I am not a networking guy, so I'm sure there is an explanation for this bug or phenomenon, but the 8500 has never ever had that problem. In fact the 8500 has well over 96,000 prints and is just like it was new. We only now print to the 8600 when we have to.So besides the networking issue with the 8600 series and apple computer (not sure on windows machines), the only other real complaint is the awkward paper loading tray. The 8500 gives you a nice upward slant to EASILY put paper in. The 8600 is a straight only pull out tray, cumbersome at best - poor design on that part for sure.The only reason we bought an 8600 is because the 8500 was no longer available new, and we were waiting for HP to ship our new print heads for the 8500.So, long story short, the 8500 is still our best printer, while the 8600 has issues, is now the lesser of our two printers and it seems that HP cheated on the ink supply with the 8600 as we are filling them more often the the 8500 and we print more with the 8500 at the same resolutions, dpi, quality, paper, etc.HP must have some way they are pinching pennies putting on a new shell with a few bells and whistles for the 8600 series, as we find it no better than 8500 and we are happy still in our 3rd year with the 8500 at the 96,000 + prints it just keeps on going.

Title: COMPATIBILITY ISSUES
Review: BEWARE!  There are compatibility issues with HP products if you have a digital (VoiP) phone system.  HP won't admit it, but clearly there are issues.  I talked with 2 different HP troubleshooting people, and both blamed my phone company.  This turned out not to be the case.  The directions supplied by HP for installation are NOT accurate, and once again HP refuses to accept that fact.  I like the machine, just have had multiple issues with installation of the fax due to inaccurate info from HP!  I was even told by an HP "case manager" that no HP products are compatible with digital phone systems, and this is clearly NOT true.

Title: help good
Review: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One Wireless Color Printer with... bad service 12 day out ? buy diff one next time

Title: Great All-in-one!
Review: I LOVE my HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus!!  It's done everything I've asked of it without any issues or problems.  I am just now about to replace the ink cartridges after owning it for over a year.  I would recommend this machine to anyone who's looking for a printer that does everything.  One of my favorite features is the duplex (front/back) printing.  It will even allow you to choose black ink only if some of the color inks are out.  You can get a great deal on ink cartridges, too, at the HP Home website as they send you coupons, and if you're signed up with Ebates, you get money back there, too.  I was able to get next-day shipping FREE.  Highly recommend this printer!!!!

Title: crap
Review: The HP 8600 is a piece of crap. Do not waste your money or time - which you will spend inordinate amounts of to get this thing to do basic functions.I can't count the endless hours of frustration and waiting to see if a print job would actually complete..each printing attempt would take forever, inconsistently successful in actual printing. Main issue = Connection issues with BOTH wifi and when hardwired.Worst experience ever. DO NOT BUY!

Title: I like the printer BUT......
Review: We purchased this printer in June of 2012 ans its now March 2013 and we have just gotten an alert to install new ink. Wow! starter cartridges worked for a good while. We don't print a massive amount though. Now the printer works awesome in all ways.... But the printer is now not working. Printhead failure or printer failure. Either way HP is sending me a Re- Certified machine???? Hmmm I had to go through service tech, hardware supervisor, then corporate complaint. I was treated fair but I'm an IT professional and will not accept any guff from telephone call center types. They told me I would receive a re-conditioned unit, I asked them what that is.... a refurbished unit?? They said no they do not repair them anymore, not cost effective. The re-conditioned unit is a new printer that was sold to a retailer or wholesaler that was returned new for credit. They stated its the law that unit cannot be sold as new again..... Hmmm I will have to look into that..... The jury is still out but HP corp complaints division stated they would get the printer to me in by Tuesday and its Friday at 4 pm now, so we will see. He also stated I would have a full 2 year warranty on the re-conditioned machine. Their definition: re-conditioned is a product returned for credit new but has been tested and certified and reboxed in a plain box and utilized  for warranty. I hope HP doesn't let me down on this.

Title: Great reviews
Review: After my last experience with an HP printer I was really shy about this purchase. But HP really surprised me with this printer. Great scanner, fax and printer and the larger ink cartridges are a big plus.

Title: Very FRUSTRATING
Review: I have owned this troublesome printer for a less than a month.  I have contacted Customer Support (and I use the term support generously) 5 times.1)  The printer cannot stay installed for more than a week to 10 days.  When I go to my handy dandy HP assistant, it is not there, the option to install is there... only it will not completely install.  Four times HP has remotely uninstalled, downloaded the full featured drivers from their website and reinstalled.  Each time they state the last tech support person must have only installed the basic drivers.  The printer will work fine... for a while.  2)  Then the printer started stalling in the middle of printing and randomly spitting out blank pages at the end of the print.  I called HP for the third or fourth time.  When I went into my HP assitant to explain the other things that I had done to solve these problems, my assitant was gone AGAIN.  Then I had to explain to Robin that I am NOT a fool.  I did NOT click on some setup.exe file, I clicked on the very same icon that I always use to find my ink levels etc.  This has been the most troublesome printer that I have ever owned.  And if I did not already have $500 in ink to use up, that thing would already be returned to the store!  Do not purchase this printer, it is not worth the headache!  And if you are wondering why I would have $500 in ink, that is also a pain in the but with this printer.  Even if what you are printing is all black ink and you have a full black cartridge, it will not print properly if one of the color ones are empty.  So when it tricked me by working for 10 straight days I purchased 2 XL of each color and black ink.  I foolishly opened them and put them in the sealed container I use to store my extra ink because the boxes do not fit neatly into that space.  As for Customer Support... well that's just a joke.  They are always experiencing 'higher than normal calls at this time' well I can see why!!!!  I did accidentally get their online chat support one time, I wish it was more clear how to do that directly.  I clicked on it while registering the printer.  I actually got the tech support for icloud and he transfered me. It is very difficult to speak to someone with a language barrier on the phone!  I wish that they had a direct online chat support.  It must exist, but when I attempt to go through their website, it does not recognize 'HP Officeject Pro 8600 Plus'.  Their option to 'search my device' did not work.  Perhaps that is because the thing will not remain installed.Oh, and the quality is not great.  I can only print graphs and such on 'draft' because on normal they get smeared by the third page.  I then have to through the cleaning process that eats up a lot of ink.  I purchased this computer specifically to print out pie charts and graphic presentations.  I had an HP Photosmart 4700 and upgraded because I wanted better quality on my projects, specifically the colors.  I should have stayed with it.  The 8600 does not print on cardstock well.  I've followed all of the tips, and I can nurse it along to make a copy, but it is crushed at the top.  I have also found that the ADF will crush the original, so I have to do that manually.  The ONLY thing that I have found this printer to be able to do that it says it will with any regularity is the dual sided automatic copy.  That is amazing and the only reason it got two stars.

Title: Very good but may it needs to be faster
Review: I think it is very good in its works but some times I feel it needs to be a little bit faster

Title: Nice printer, only there are a few drawbacks like single envelope printing in Word 2010
Review: I have never had a printer that could not easily handle printing a single envelope until the HP Officejet 8600 Plus printer. I struggled with this multiple times until I found a work around solution someone shared online.Btw I was using Windows 7 Pro 64 bit and  (Word 2010-- in Office Professional 32-bit) and this HP 8600 Plus with the single slide in tray.How I printed a single number 10 envelope on my HP 8600 Plus printer...-Using a regular new document not produced under the every nonfunctional Mailings -heading--Use landscape orientation under the Page Layout, then in the Size option and choose Envelope# 10-Type in your Return address and To address like you want to see it printed on the envelope.-When I asked to print, a message came up that the copy was 'outside the margins' so I had to adjust the left edge of the return address a bit to line up on the envelope. The message `outside the margins' still comes up but it printed ok.  Return address is not as high as I would have preferred but it is still ok.Note that you have to take all your standard size paper out of the tray and load with some #10 envelopes. Tighten the tabs, that will hold the envelopes face down in the middle of the tray.After you print be sure and reload your paper tray with regular paper.What a pain!Another thing is that you had better have the expensive backup ink cartridges (both the three color ones and black one) on hand quickly after you get a notice that your ink is low because when the ink runs out it stops abruptly.  That is a pain too. Other than these things so far after 6 months of pretty heavy use I've been pleased with this printer. I have always had HP printers because I was pleased with their service. Sadly my service experiences with this printer have not been good, Multiple times I was kept on the line for extremely long times while foreign service reps seemed to be reading me useless rhetoric.  One call was setting up my fax and I made multiple calls trying to print these single envelopes.If you can set the printer to print front and back sides of your paper to save on paper and you can also set to print with black ink only to save on the color ink cartridges.There are things I wish I understood better like do I have to change out all the colors when one of the colors runs out? If anyone knows let me know and please if you know an easier way to print envelopes let me know. Any other tips appreciated too.Hope this helps someone else.

Title: Do not by any HP printers
Review: Each one we have ever owned never lasted beyond a few months.  They have a glitch where the printer does not recognize the ink cartridges, after that the printer becomes unusable.  I could never recommend any HP printer to anyone.

Title: Great printer except for envelopes
Review: Very pleased with this HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus printer.  Biggest shortcoming is in printing envelopes.  Fortunately, I have an old HP Deskjet that I can use to print envelopes. Windows 7 does not allow me to change printers for envelopes.  I must first start the regular print process for full sheet printing, change printers, cancel the printing, print the envelopes with the old printer, and then change the printer choice back to the 8600 plus. This takes about the same time as removing the paper from the 8600 paper tray, putting in the envelopes, printing them, and then replacing the paper in the tray. But, I can do it all from the keyboard if the envelopes are already loaded in the old printer. Although the 8600 is much faster than the old printer, the old printer prints envelopes with reasonable speed. I had trouble with envelopes because I was placing the envelopes on the right side of the tray as I did on my old HP printer. If the envelope is placed in the middle of the tray, it can be placed on top of the paper in the tray, and it works fine.  If you have a stack of envelopes, you can take the paper out, and keep the stack of envelopes in the middle of the tray by moving in the width adjustments. I have decided to give the 8600 Plus 5 stars. XL print cartridges are quite expensive, but they print so many pages that the cost per page is the cheapest of any printer that I know of. I like the wireless feature, as I can print from my cell phone and another network computer. Setup was easy. It had to be for an 86 year old who is not too computer savvy.

Title: Great all in one printer - scanning software lacks features of some of the older HP models
Review: This is a great all-in-one printer. I purchased it with the double side printing option. It has worked well with no jams to date. The feeder also works well. Setup was a bit complicated, but made easy by the online, on screen help. Considering all the features, it was a breeze. The software for scanning on my old C7280 was much better. It allowed for scanning multiple photos and self identified each one, storing as a separate file. It also auto-cropped a single picture. The software for this 8600 doesn't appear to have these features. The scan resolution is a bit difficult to change and also doesn't have as many choices as the C7280. I'm going to attempt to load the software back on from the C7280 and see if it will recognize and use the 8600. If you're not doing a lot of photo scanning, then this wouldn't be a big deal. The copy feature is simple, as it should be. I haven't faxed through it yet. Like most, faxing is not seldom needed in our more digital world. Just scan your docs and email them. Save the wood, feed a beaver.

Title: Stopped Working
Review: This printer worked okay, at best, for a few months. It printed very slow, but it at least produced a printed copy. Then a few months later, the problems began -- error messages, alternating between printing and no printing, alternating between poor quality and good quality, etc. For this tech savvy buyer, this very unreliable printer has been a pain to work with.To resolve this printer issue, I rushed one evening to Staples to buy a highly-rated and much less expensive Epson printer just in time for the kids to complete their major homework project. The whole family is loving the Epson WorkForce WF-3520 color printer.

Title: great double-sided printer
Review: I bought this because I'm an online student who can't read online for more than a few minutes.  I print out about a hundred pages of articles per week.  This printer makes double-sided printing a snap.  It prints fairly quickly.  It also makes nice copies.  I find the scanner much less user-friendly, but I rarely need to use it so I don't care much.  I've never used the fax portion.Setting it up was a snap since it's wireless.  You basically just push a button and it talks to your computer and they figure it out for you.  After setting it up with my main computer, I've successfully printed from my laptop, friends' laptops, etc with no further set up required.I've owned many cheap, crappy printers over the years and this is the only printer I've ever recommended to friends!

Title: Amazing Printer
Review: This is my first "smart" printer, and actually the first printer I've bought since around 2000 or so.  So I was definitely impressed with all the things it can do.  I'm a fan of the printer apps (with the Forms one you can print out things like music paper, graph paper, to do lists, etc straight from the printer with no need for a computer) and I LOVE the e-print feature.  You just send an email with your document as an attachment, from anywhere and any computer, and it prints.  Initial setup of the machine was really easy.It's not small, and it's kinda loud, but those are really the only things I could say about it that aren't 100% positive.  I did have an issue where a double-sided document I printed wasn't exactly lined up on the back side (the top got cut off) but I'm not sure if that was the printer's issue or mine.I haven't tried printing any high-quality photos on photo paper, so I can't say anything about how well it does that.  But overall I definitely recommend this printer.

Title: Love it!
Review: It is speedy, easy to install, and except for a few little bugs, it has been very reliable. Didn't realize something like this was even available for home use!

Title: Inadequate tech support
Review: After three months of on and off again technical problems for which there was inadequate or confusing tech support, my printer is finally up and running well. An example: immediately upon trying to install the operating system i got a message that the printer was not compatible with my operating system and tat the system was unsupported. Reading the HP website confirmed this. I had requested a return slip from the seller (which they supplied) when a friend told me there was a link to a new istall that supported the printer on another part of the HP site. An example, I found two completely different HP web pages with instructions for setting up the wireless printing connection for the printer. One did not result in the correct setup. I only found the correct setup instructions by accident when looking for another topic. There have been other problems as well.The seller was cooperative,but not very knowledgeable. The HP website was confusing and inadequate.

Title: Extremely Slow Color Printing Over Wireless
Review: Brand New HP 8600 Pro printing Extremely Slow with Surfboard 5101, Airport Express, and Brand New iMac with ATT 15mbs Roadrunner.I just bought this printer to improve print times over my Kodak 2170 printer. I have the exact same set up as before, and the HP 8600 Pro prints only about 2 pages per minute. My speed tests today ran about 16mbs for my internet connection.Should I return the printer or is there a fix?

Title: Good pick!
Review: Easy to set up, easy to use, all functions work as advertised.  Good product!  Recommend to anyone looking for a high quality all-in-one printer.

Title: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One Wireless Color Printer
Review: If you are looking for a very good and reliable all in one printer this is it. As always, HP did a great job with this unit.  I love the two-sided printing option. The ink cartridges, resolution, speed and simplicity of the unit is phenomenal.  I truly recommend this unit.

Title: Awesome printer!
Review: We love this printer.  We haven't owned to very long, but we are impressed with it.  It prints very quickly.  I like that I can print to it from the iPad.  It has a lot of features for the price.

Title: Printer
Review: The best purchase that I have made in a long while. This printer is much more that I need, however it is extremely versitile.

Title: Wish it would print
Review: I was very excited when I got this printer. Setup was relatively easy and intuitive, the only drawback is that it won't print - a significant drawback for a printer! It printed the calibration page, and then gave me an "ink cartridge failure" error. I loaded my brand new ink cartridges that I purchased the night before (so they weren't stale or dried up) into the printer, to no avail. This message has turned out to be the equivalent of The Blue Screen of Death you might see on your computer. I found a good number of results when I Googled the problem, including a video of a gentleman demonstrating how to tape aluminum foil over the contacts to fool the printer into working. I may have considered this solution if the printer were more than two days old.HP tech support was as clueless as the online reviewers said they were, but I humored them and went through the recommended "fix" steps for the gojillionth time. They did offer to send me a replacement print head. So that the next time this happens it will be too late to return it? No thanks. I did not see any comments of this problem when researching this product. I will Google for problems before I make my next printer purchase.

Title: Darn good aii-in-one unit.
Review: I used it for a couple of years and it was fast and it was my first fax that I got to work.  The fax worked until I switched to from Cox Communications to Centurylink internet.  I never contacted tech support so I can not say why it did'nt work.  This 8600 started giving me problems when I started using generic brands of ink cartridges.  My advice is to stick to manufactuers inks.

Title: Paper jams
Review: I had bad experiences w hp all in ones before due to paper jamming, this one is not exempted. When it finds my Mac, wifi scanning is great. Brother has much better paper handling.

Title: great machine
Review: does everything i hoped it would do. a definite plus to any home office (or small business) and I recommend it highly

Title: Does useful things I didn't even know a wireless all in one" could do!"
Review: I would have given it five stars, but can you really LOVE "an all in one" printer, copier, scanner...etc?Quiet, fast, clear sharp black and white and color printing, copying, and scanning of multi-page files as color or B&W pdf's and at a variety of resolutions!Very Easy to use and set up.Let's say its a great unit deserving of 5 stars!

Title: Dont be fooled by the good reviews, HP printers are still garbage
Review: Their software is not even compatible with USB 3.0 and will crash your computer. I promised myself I'll never get another HP again but I did.. big regret. Just a waste of a few hours and back to the store. HP will always be garbage.

Title: Wicked fast printing and Great Apps too
Review: I purchased this HP 8600 Plus printer when my 4 year old OfficeJet 6450 died. I purchased it locally, since I need to print soon and couldn't wait. The upgrade was like going from a Volkswagen Beetle to a Lamborghini.The ability to send a file to your printer from anywhere in the world where you can access your email is awesome. (HP e-printing)From your HP ePrintCenter account, you can manage everything, including add/remove apps, create marketing and business materials, and so much more.If your close to making or need to make a printer purchase, this printer can handle your home or small business needs easily.

Title: Very Happy
Review: We are very happy witht the purchase of this unit.  It works as advertized and is eazy to use.  I would highly recommend this machine to anyone who needs reliability.

Title: Great Device
Review: This printer, scanner, copier, Fax works great. It's easy to setup and the wireless funtionality is great.  I would highly recommend it!

Title: I think this was a reconditioned unit, and the supplier (not HP) was no help at all
Review: As received from the supplier (I didn't do anything but try to set to up and use it).1. I followed the directions on the install disc, and it kept giving me an error message that I could not get past. I contacted the supplier, and the said no one else has had any problems, reinstall it. I had, of course, tried that!In the end, I had to get a professional to install it. Cost me $100. After installation, I was so glad I could print some urgent work, we didn't test the scanner.The next day,l tried to scan a document. It didn't work so I sent the printer back.Several people have told me that this is an excellent printer, and they are probably right. My complaint is the.lack of support from the supplier, and that the information I received  required reading the whole manual to find out how to contact HP.The only really good part of this is that, through Amazon,  I got all my money back.

Title: Nice All-in-one
Review: At first, I thought the setup was a bit intimidating. But it went surprisingly fast considering this is the first time I "networked" a printer.

Title: GET AN EXTENDED WARRENTY...just in case needed!
Review: I have had this item HP Ink Jet all in one printer since 5-27-12 I use it for home and personal usage. I am a preschool teacher. I use it to scan print almost on a daily basis and hadn't had any issues. Until recently I experienced an issue with the on/off button not working properly and now not lighting up at all. Called customer service for HP and spent over 1 1/2 hours with them to only....send me a refurbished unit! First they wanted to send me a power cord...when clearly it was more than a power cord issue! *ONLY will send a Refurbished unit and nothing more....please make sure that you get an extended warranty with your purchase!! It will save you a ton of headaches in the meantime. Great unit and machine! Unfortunately crummy technical support and customer service on HP's end of the deal!

Title: HP spyware and Ink cartridge scam.  I now hate HP.
Review: The printer works.  However, I ran out of Magenta ink.  So, I said thats fine.  I'll just print in black only.  However, I started getting these stupid pop-up messages on my computer saying I need to order more Magenta ink online from HP.  These windows would pop-up repeatedly through out the day, even if I haven't printed in a week.  For two weeks, I never printed in anything other than Black.  Then today when I booted up my computer, I get a message saying that I need to install new ink NOW! and my printer will be unable to function until I get new magenta ink. Keep in mind that I just want to print in black.So, here it is in a nutshell.  HP puts spyware on your computer to track your ink usage.  I didn't buy Magenta ink fast enough (within about two weeks) for their liking so their Nazi software disabled my printer--holding it hostage until I buy magenta.  It was working fine until their software decided that NO you can't just print in black only.  You need to give HP more money now or else!I had important papers to print for a meeting tomorrow so I was forced to go get the Magenta to break my printer out of jail.  As soon as I installed the Magenta, I could print my important papers in black once again.  I even got an annoying pop-up thanking me for purchasing Genuine Magenta Ink from HP.This is all a scam.  Those ink cartridges are expensive and HP wants you to buy as many as possible.  Buy two sets and you could just buy a new printer for the cost.  Thats how they make their money.  So they put this software in there to keep track of how long ago your ran out of magenta.  After a certain period of time, they just disable the printer to force you do buy it from them--even if you don't need friggen magenta.All I have to say is this: F-you HP.  Never again.Don't buy this product from these scam artists.  Don't financially support companies that do these kind of shady practices and install invasive spyware on your computer, keeping track of your behavior, just so they and nickle and dime you to death.

Title: HP Printer
Review: Great product, fast shipping, easy setupLove HP printer products highly recommend to anyone looking for a great printer at a great price

Title: Fantastic printer
Review: We are very happy with HP 8600, It works beautiful while we use our iPads  with wireless printers. Thanks smile

Title: good all-in-one
Review: Easy to set up and use, reasonably small footprint. Crisp type images and good color. Very pleased with this printer/copier, etc.

Title: A great printer until it stopped working
Review: I purchased this printer about 9 months ago, admittedly not from Amazon, and it was easy to install and worked really well. Good quality printing, the scanner and copier were easy to use and worked well. I occasionally used the fax, and that seemed to be fine. Everything was great until one day the printer stopped working. It turns on, but every print job results in messages about a paper jam, and removing the back paper feeder and following a seemingly endless set of instructions.That would be o.k. occasionally; printers jam, right ? But following the instructions never actually achieves anything. So I went to the HP support site and entered a plea for help. Three weeks later I have not had a response, which I find very disappointing.Up until then I really liked the printer; it's in my home 'office' and I print work and personal documents, it printed from our iPads, my Mac and Windows laptops. The ability to scan to a PDF on my personal computer was helpful. If only the printer were more reliable (i.e. it still worked) I'd be one happy camper.As it is, I give it one star because a) it doesn't work and b) HP's support is dreadful.Next stop, back to the shop and hope that they are interested enough to help.

Title: HP 8600 Pro Plus a waste of money.....
Review: Purchased the HP 8600 Pro Plus Printer just over a year ago.  3 weeks out of warranty, the printhead went bad. I attempted to purchase the part on-line but could not find it anywhere. I talked with 4 people at HP and an HP rep at Best Buy.  HP had the printhead for $100 but did not recommend purchase because they could not guarantee it would fix the problem.  The best they could offer was to have me buy the SAME printer again but this time they agreed to give me a 2 year warranty.  Spending another $220 for the same printer after only one year, even with a 2 year warranty this time, is ridiculous.  If I have to buy another printer, it won't be HP as they don't stand behind their products. And the customer service was terrible.  I could barely understand 2/4 people I spoke with on the phone.  when I mentioned this to the HP Best Buy rep, he said next time I should ask for their Canada division.  They don't have customer serv or tech in the USA?

Title: So far, so good
Review: I have read both positive and negative reviews on this site and others.  So far, I am on the 'very happy' side.  Some people knock the quality but quite frankly for the price I paid at a local store the performance is, to this point, exceeding my expectations.  Some people didn't like that you had to remove paper to put in special paper, envelopes, etc.  Again, for this price range I do not see that as a standard expectation.  I LOVE the auto-two-sided print option.  Most of my work is as a consultant and my primary clients are at a distance so most of what I print for work is for my own review and use so being able to conveniently and quickly set this printer up to print two-to a page, double sided as the default was very welcome.  My last printer, a very lousy Lexmark product not only required manually flipping the paper but also wasted paper by printing out an extra sheet after a '2-sided' print request on how to flip and reinsert the paper to get a book print setup final product...EVERY time...was very inefficient and much slower than this machine.  I also keep my print quality defaulted to low-quality as most of my stuff is for draft...still is very clear and easy to read.  I will use it for photos and graphics to a point but primarily wanted a straight-up work printer with high functionality, efficiency, and ease of use so for me, this is a great printer. I don't currently need much of the wireless capability but expect that to change so am glad this machine has this feature. People with more extreme needs probably need to invest in a higher-end machine--this seems to be ideal for a very small business or home-use printer.

Title: Great printer easy to set up
Review: Very easy to setup and the ePrint is a good feature.I would definitely recommend this printer over the lesser modelsbecause the document feeder is of better quality.

Title: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus
Review: This printer/scanner is in use in a smaller office (12 employees).  It's print speed and cost is better than the low end color laser we were using.  Printed copy is fine for typical office use.

Title: Great printer for the price
Review: We were replacing an old HP photosmart and based on the reviews this one seemed to be a good choice.  And it was.  Setup was easy and it works just fine from the computer and also from our iPad.  I hope it will be cheaper to run in terms of cartridges than our old one.  So far it seems to do everything just fine.

Title: One fast Officejet printer.  Rivals a laserjet.
Review: Large machine.  No problem, I have the room.  Fast.  Really fast.  Setup a bit cumbersome but worked through the bugs, without calling manufacturer (an achievement).  Looking forward to seeing how long the ink cartridges last.  Jury still out.  Display makes use easy.  Scan, fax, copy, print etc.  It's all there on easy-to-read display.  So far, really good...

Title: Great printer except
Review: you can't use the paper feed. It will eat your document. Sadly we learned this lesson with a document that was a huge pain to replace.

Title: So far so good
Review: Pro-Works as expected setup easy, don't know how long the ink will last.Con- made in ChinaWould pay more for made in USA.

Title: Perfectly suited for the home office
Review: For all around printer copier fax great buy for the money for the user who needs an economical all in one

Title: Buyer Beware!  Printing B&W bleeds down color ink
Review: The printer works great, but it has a MAJOR flaw.  The real cost of printing is the cost of ink cartridges, not the printer.  Unfortunately, this printer uses colored ink even when you're printing black & white.  You can't turn the color ink usage off.  The rationale is that using color ink improves black and white print quality, and keeps the ink flowing smoothly.  Once one of your color cartridges is depleted the printer just flat stops printing--black & white, or in any color--until you replace the depleted color cartridge.  And, the color ink cartridges are very pricey.  Bleeding down the color ink every time you print black & white seems like a major design flaw to me, and they certainly don't tell you about it up front.  I do most of my printing in black & white and use color very rarely because of the cost.  I need a printer that's economical to operate, so I'll be replacing this one.

Title: It's great...when it works.
Review: Ok, I'm going to try to keep this short.I bought this printer on Amazon in June, 2012. As of about 2 weeks ago (March, 2014) it's quit working altogether.I've had issues on and off with it since I bought it. The main problem was that it would randomly give me a "Paper Jam" error message when there was no paper jam to be found. I would contact HP Support and they would walk me through whatever steps and it would usually resolve the issue.A few weeks ago, it gave me that stupid message out of nowhere, I went through all the steps HP Support had previously walked me through, and none of them worked. I unplugged it, left it for about 3 days, and then plugged it in again and...IT WORKED! Well, for about 1 minute. After printing one page, it gave me a "Load Paper" error message. I checked, and the tray had plenty of paper in it. I fiddled with it for a bit, and it began feeding the paper only to jam (for real this time). I cleared the jam and tried again. I could hear the paper feeding, then the crunching of it being wrinkled in the feeder. Another actual paper jam.So now, I'm getting a load paper error when there is an actual paper jam and a tray full of paper. I have no idea how to fix it, it's out of warranty and I'm stuck with a $220 machine and another $170 worth of XL ink cartridges that are all totally useless.I've contacted HP support about this (again) and hopefully will get somewhere with them this time.If you want to buy this machine, go for it, just be prepared to have weekly or monthly conversations with HP Support, and put back the $ to buy another one when warranty expires.

Title: Faithful Printer...learning about the other features.
Review: We have this in our church office.  I printed off 400+ page duplexed for an event with little trouble.  It is quiet, fast and has many options for a small office.  We have volunteers use it often, with no trouble.  Others have connected to it wirelessly, but I have yet to make that work for my laptop.

Title: I have three of these and they all work great.
Review: Have three of them and they work great.  For an ink jet type of printer, they are pretty frugal on the ink.  The doc feeder works well too, as long as you do not overload it

Title: HP 8600 Plus Printer
Review: This printer does what I need I like that you can scan to your computer. I like the enclosed paper tray. Its a little slower printing than my old HP Printer, but fast enough for me. So far it hasn't given me any trouble but only time will decide that.

Title: hp 8500 OFFICEJET WIRELESS PRO
Review: total piece of junk, put all new cartidges in, ran all deep cleaning cycles, will not print black, even with new black cartridge, wasted 100 DOLLARS in cartridges  on this POS,  DON'T BUY HP !!  DON'T BUY HP !!

Title: Great Printer
Review: This HP was easy to set up and interfaced with our home computers, cell phones and iPads with no problem. The fact that you can run out of one color and continue to print is a big plus.

Title: Love It
Review: I had a Brothers printer before this one and it's was a lot of work to copy, fax, or scan something because I had to do a page at a time and this took a lot of time if you have a lot of paper to do.  So I've been looking at this on for some time now and debuting to get it so I finally did and I'm glad that I did, the only thing about it is, it's so big.

Title: A perfect home printer option.
Review: I bought this all-in-one printer because I knew I was going to be doing a lot of copying and emailing.  I really like how easy it is to set up the unit to print wirelessly and to copy a document directly into your email program for quick and easy dissemination.

Title: all in one printer scanner
Review: Good purchase - negative feature is changing from paper to photo paper.  Previous owned 'all in one' didn't require removing drawer to make change. Didn't gook up to phone line because we don't send FAX or receive FAX.  For others that do, its a nice feature.

Title: Nice Machine
Review: Good quality print, nice colors.  Used as printer, copier, scanner, and fax in that order.  Black streaks when I changed the toner, but stopped by itself after a couple of pages.  Easy to use, and works with different computers no problem.

Title: Printhead causes errors after short usage time.
Review: I have owned this printer for about 18 months.  All of a sudden it no longer prints.  It keeps giving an error message about a missing printhead.  I have searched on the Internet for an answer to address the problem.  The only answers I can find are 1) buy another printer or 2) buy a new printhead for almost half the price of a new printer.  I am really disappointed in the lack of longevity for this printer.  I will not buy HP printers again.

Title: GREAT PRINTER AND SUPPORT
Review: I went back to HP with this purchase because of problems with LEXMARK (PIECE OF JUNK) and I have been pleasantly surprised at how much I like this printer considering past Hp products. I had a little trouble setting up the web apps, I called HP support they referred me once to a higher level of support. the guy advised to add HP's DNS servers to the settings on the Printer and wallah the web apps connected and worked great. The last time I utilized HP support about 5 years ago, I was very disappointed with the crappy service, but this was nice. I recommend the Printer. PS: iPrint WORKS GREAT WITH MY APPLE PRODUCTS, A VERY BIG PLUS!!!

Title: Good,  so far
Review: No problems so far.  One minor install glitch.  HP tech was able to quickly resolve the issue.  Too early for long term opinion.

Title: The best printer  I've ever owned!
Review: Purchased this for home and some home-office usage. Wireless feature works with laptops, smart phones, and desktops. Ink usage, thus far, has been reasonable. Simple screen allows even those of us who are technology-challenged to use its various functions.

Title: HP 8600
Review: Haven't had it long enough to have a strong opinion but appears to be a good multifunction device. Typical HP the ink is overpriced and the printer is a good value.

Title: Space and time saver.
Review: I am consolidating a 30 year Military medical career of journal articles, SOP's etc into digital format.  This printer has been awesome with the auto feed and wireless capabilities.

Title: So Far, So Good
Review: Easy to setup and get going.  Print quality is high, and better than my previous HP Officejet 6310 AIO.  Very fast in printing.  Only "negatives" are a) a bit slow to initiate and complete a Copy task (I'm comparing to my former laser copier) and b) the inevitable, periodic software updates, and associated HP emails that one gets.  Otherwise, machine is doing everything that I've asked it to do, and is doing it well.

Title: Exceeded my expectations
Review: Other home network printers I have purchased (won't name names) have been noisy, unreliable, cannot handle large print jobs without chewing up paper, go through ink cartridges like crazy, and are difficult to load paper into.  This printer is QUIET (not one of my "must haves" but definitely a PLUS), prints 2 sided without a lot of extra effort, feeds paper flawlessly.  I have yet to run out of ink, but it seems to be stingy on ink usage and pricing cartridges at the local office supply store, they are ~25% less expensive than the ones I had been buying.We had 2 older network printers and both are GONE!  Highly recommend the HP Officejet Pro!

Title: Just what we needed
Review: This year, we purchased two rental properties and found ourselves going through mounds of paper just in the purchase process and then another mound of paper in lease signing and correspondence. Our old printer started to strain under the increased demand, it wasn't designed to handle that much usage. I spent a couple of days researching printers: reading reviews and articles. Most printers had similar features but we needed three key features: wireless connection, sheet feeder for copying/scanning and duplex printing. Those features limited our choices of printers and forced us to spend quite a bit more. After going through reviews I chose this printer over a similar Cannon model. Sorry, but I don't have my notes to recall what the key factor but I suspect it was purely price.The printer was easy to install and works flawlessly in wireless mode. I haven't attempted to use it from my ancient Macbook which I use for casual use. We only print from our PC based desktop computers both running Windows 7.I enjoy scanning with this printer, previous scanners and multifunction printers required so much more back and forth to scan in a document, with this printer you can scan directly into your computer from the printer control panel. If your computer is in the other room, you can bring the document to the scanner, put it in the sheet feeder, start the scan and it will automatically go to your computer back to your desk. This little device has saved me a lot of time scanning in lengthy documents.Many of the reviews stated that the sheet feeder for copying and scanning is fickle but I only have problems with it when putting previously folded documents through the sheet feeder. If I take a moment to flatten the creases before I attempt to feed it through, they feed just fine. Papers that have never been folded or otherwise mangled buzz through the sheet feeder for copying or scanning with ease, much better than I expected. I haven't tried to sheet feed odd sized documents, just several regular paper sized documents.The printer goes in and out of sleep mode with ease also. It turns itself back on and readies itself after power outages also. When you need to print, there is not a lengthy pause for it to wake up and start printing. When I need to scan, similar quick response. Only one blue light remains lit in sleep mode, so I assume its power drain is minimal in sleep mode.I use online deposit function with my bank. My bank and the scanner function of this printer got along fine from their first date and have a rock solid relationship. I didn't have to do anything, they just found each other, shook hands, and exchanged data from my first attempt. I was expecting to have to do something but I guess they were made for each other.Overall, I'm very happy with this printer. We found a slightly better deal on another site than Amazon, otherwise we would have preferred to buy it here. We've had it for since Mid December 2012.I'm a frequent Amazon purchaser and prefer to put my reviews here. I will most likely update this review next winter.

Title: Does everything I want
Review: I replaced a four-year old HP that was similar.  I hope the present one has been built to last even longer.

Title: Excellent Printer
Review: I bought this printer about a month ago and so far everything works great. The only thing I have been unable to get to work is the 'scan to (computer) folder' option on the keypad, but I can still scan to computer so that is not a big issue. Since I own a HP computer I know that calling their tech support is time consuming and useless. After seeing all the negative reviews I was very reluctant to buy the printer. After finally deciding to do it anyway, I purchased it from Best Buy rather than on line, and bought the 2 year extended warranty. This way if anything goes wrong, they will replace it with a new one instead of a refurbised one from HP, and if the model has been discontinued they will replace it with the newer model. I rarely buy these warranties, but in this case I considered a good investment.

Title: Best printer I have ever owned
Review: I would recommend this printer to everyone. This thing is the best purchase I have ever made on amazon. Every part of it works perfectly. I can print from my iPhone and iPad, fax, scan copy. You name it it does it!

Title: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-All-in-One Wireless Color Printer
Review: I am enjoying the 8600 Plus. No problems yet. Easy setup (instructions great even fora semi-techinally person like my self.)

Title: Replaced Eleven Year Old HP DeskJet - good choice.
Review: Unfortunately first printer delivered had a defective Automatic Feed.  Called HP, we tried to work through it, when that failed they sent a new printer out.  No argument.  No hassle.  New machine arrived quickly, was tested thoroughly and we are loving it.  Prints from desktop, two laptops, iPad and iPhones.  Fax and scanner both work.  Easy to set up (even by this senior citizen).  Love the Apps feature.  Praise for quick delivery from Amazon.  Can only hope it runs as effortlessly and as well as the old monster DeskJet it replaced.

Title: Excellent printer
Review: After over a decade using laser printers, I was initially skeptical that an inkjet could deliver the speed and quality I was used to with text documents. I print a lot of scripts. But I also liked the idea of having access to color, and the reviews were positive. It has not disappointed. Text pages come out quickly and quietly, and are crisp. Ink usage is acceptable. After several reams I'm still on my starter black cartridge. Touchscreen interface is easy to use, PC driver is fine, and scanner is quick and easy. I have had no problems with the wireless connection. Photos are pretty nice, too, not quite as vibrant or sharp as what you could get with a photo printer, but just fine for casual use. Duplexing works great and I haven't had any paper jams. Very happy with this purchase -- all around solid performance.

Title: 4 printers, 4 failures
Review: Very disappointed. After 4 different printers in 2 weeks (each one lasted less than 3 days before problems arose), we have given up on HP for our business. We quit buying HP printers a few years ago because of quality problems. We let ourselves be talked back into trying their new 'top of the line' 8600. The first one had scanning/faxing problems after about 2 days (a line down the middle of the page). The second printer had the same exact problem. The third printer could not successfully set up because of print head issues and the forth started squeaking loudly after about 2 days. 4 new printers, four bad fails...Needless to say we are looking into other printers and definitely NOT HP. To their credit they replaced them as they failed, but holy cow... 4 for 4 ! We stopped the loss there when they offered to send the 5th printer out. HP quality used to be the best, but our experience the last few years puts them way down the list. A few years ago I wouldn't look at any other brand for a printer. Now I will no longer look at HP.

Title: Only One Disappointment
Review: Shipping was fast.  Setup a breeze.  BUT, I lost the capability to copy to the clipboard, which I used often on my previous HP all-in-one printer.  Would have given it 5 stars if It had the lost feature.

Title: HP 8600 Plus
Review: The e-all in-one by HP arrived on time in excellent condition and I love it! Works like a charm! It is much more than just a printer which what I needed for my small office space.

Title: CAN NOT PRINT BLACK AND WHITE WITH EMPTY COLOR CARTRIDGE(S)
Review: That is my only complaint about this worthless piece of crap, and it's a total deal killer. I print about 1 color page for every 500 or 1000 black and white pages, yet it continually uses color ink to keep the print head clean. So for me the cost of printing a color copy is about $20 and B & W costs have just went up exponentially.  Totally worthless piece of crap design flaw. I REFUSE to buy color ink I won't use just to be able to print black and white copies. Tomorrow, I will replace it with a faster lazer Brother with a toner cost of about 1/5 of this inkjet. I guess my faxes stuck in memory that won't print will have to stay in there forever. Screw you HP. If anybody wants this POS it's in the dumpster.

Title: cover or door must be closed error
Review: I have the HP OfficeJet Pro 8600 Plus working good for a yr now.I had to replace a cyan color cartridge - simple. After I did, an error message came up that 'the cover or door must be closed to print.'The door is not open. I downloaded and ran the HP Hardware Diagnostic Utility and it comes up with closing the door and putting the cartridges in. I have done both - several times and still the error.This nonsensical error came just one week after warranty ended.I have seen alot of similiar complaints with HP printers with no real solutions?One yr and my HP Pro 8600 Plus is a throwaway.

Title: Printer
Review: Daughter and son-in-law love this printer. Double sided printing and also prints from smart phone. Easy to set up and use.

Title: excellent printer for home use
Review: easy to use and very versatile. Would recommend this for anyone that needs a home printer that include scanning and faxing capabilities

Title: Inconsistent
Review: Overall, I'm satisfied with this printer, but the software is a little klutzy and it often has difficulty establishing and maintaining a network link. It's not uncommon to have to turn it off and back on if either it or my computer has been idle for a while.It's also quite susceptible to paper jams with thinner originals, and it's sometimes very difficult to undo a jam without risking shredding the original.

Title: This printer works like a dream.
Review: I wanted an upgrade HP that would duplex print.  This printer works wonderful.  I would recommend it to others looking for a good duplex printer.  It also prints clear and sharp.

Title: Hp printer
Review: I bought it for the airprint  with my ipad.  I can print from my ipad and it worked right out of the box and i have not had any problems.  I have also faxed with it too.

Title: Great printer at a great price!
Review: After reading all the Amazon reviews, I decided to go ahead and purchase. It was out of the box and printing in 20 minutes, but only because I took my time to carefully unpackaged the item. If I were to order another, I could cut my start up time down to five minutes--it's that easy! The first time to print, I used my iPad. It was amazing! The print quality is clear and crisp. I keep the printer in another room from my modem and it has not problem with the wireless connection. I have only used the print feature in this all-in-one, but so far, I feel it is money well spent. I would give this printer five stars based on my limited use of it. It makes a nice home office printer. I have a small 36 x 20 inch desk so I keep the printer on a separate stand to maximize my workspace, but it works for me!

Title: The Paper Tray is Horrible, but besides that I would recommend
Review: The paper tray is horrible.  I have had the printer a few years now and every time I have to refill the paper, I just think that the designer should be reassigned.  Sure, it is pretty but not functional.  You cant see how much paper you have.  It clanks and is clumsy when you pull in out.  It gets caught up when inserted or removed.  When I shift to envelop it is like playing with a cheap toy manufacturer in Taiwan.  The printer itself is good and the touch screen is so far doing well.  Hope HP does a better job with the paper tray next time and heck, while their at it, has all manufacturing moved back to the United States.  Paper Tray gets a '0' and printer itself gets a '5'

Title: HP printer works every time.
Review: I purchased one to replace another brand that continually gave me problems.  This HP is a great printer.  The ink cartridge goes along way without replacing.  Best of all, this printer works every time.  I have no problems at all.  It has many features.I purchased a second HP as a Christmas gift.  Great printer.

Title: great choice
Review: I have started a home business and this printer appears to be a great solution. Highly recommended as a convenient solution.

Title: Excellent 4-in-one printer
Review: Am very happy with this printer.  Glad to be rid of the Epson monstrosity which gobbled up cartridges like a Hummer.

Title: Does not maintain wireless connection in energy save mode
Review: Energy save mode can't be disabled which HP is aware of but does not address on their support pages. When the printer goes into sleep mode, it disables the wireless connection. You can not send a print job and have the printer wake up. This is a major flaw. HP support docs has you trying 6 or 7 different procedures to fix the connection but provides no information about the energy save sleep mode problem. Poor design and support HP! I'm going back to Canon printers.

Title: Really does the job.
Review: We use this all in one printer over the summer for school work (college & grade school) as well as a small home business.  It does a great job at everything it should (printing, scanning, copying and faxing).  The document handler for duplex printing works well for standard 8 1/2" x 11" paper (haven't tried legal paper yet).  The scanner feeder works well too, and is a bonus when scanning multiple pages.We bought this printer to replace another inkjet all-in-one because ink was costing us $$$$.  We originally planned to buy a color laser all-in-one, but after shopping around and comparing all the costs (replacing toner + imager vs. ink) and checking reviews, we chose this model.  We were not sure if we were getting back "into the ink business" again.  We have been very pleasantly surprised, and are still running the original ink cartridges.  On our old printer, we would have replaced the black cartridge twice during the same period.I would recommend this printer to a friend.

Title: My HP Officejet Is perfect
Review: It is everything I was looking for in a copy machine. It goes beyond the needs I need in a copy machine.

Title: Already recommended it to a friend
Review: Just take your time setting it up; follow the instructions. Uninstall your old printer software first. This is a great printer, scanner, copier. I haven't used the fax, but I'm very happy with this printer for my home-office.

Title: nice
Review: So far so good, haven't run into anything that the printer would not do, Only thing haven't tried is manually feeding it legal paper

Title: Fast Printing and Easy to setup on multiple computers
Review: This was an excellent replacement for an aging Lexmark all-in-one.  It prints fast and clear, was easy to setup on several different computers including WindowsXP, Windows7, Windows8, and Mac.

Title: love the wireless and internet capability
Review: This printer is really cool.  I bought it in August 2012 from BestBuy where it was priced at $300 but saw it on sale for $220 online and got that price after hassling a manager.I have held onto a crappy bubble jet printer for years.  My work had nice laserjets but I wanted to wait to get an all-in-one printer until my other one died.  Now, I really wonder why I was torturing myself!There is no need to have a separate scanner or copier when you've got this printer.  It prints/scans/copies in duplex mode and you don't even have to be next to it or connected directly.  Printing is pretty fast compared to other, similar models.  Scanning is high quality; however, it works a little better on the flatbed than using the autofeed (sometimes comes out crooked with the autofeed).  I like the ability to print remotely from my work or mobile device.  Setup was a cinch and, while it is large, it doesn't seem to take up that much space (compact on all ends without anything extending outward from the base figure).I am completely content.  I haven't had any problems yet except for a few jams when I fed paper to scan into the autofeed that had rips on some of the edges---my fault, nothing to gripe about the printer.

Title: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus
Review: Performs smoothly and quietly and quickly and accurately. Print quality is fine.  Copy, Fax, and Scan functions work well. Worth the price

Title: Actually a very good AIO printer.
Review: Had another HP printer that worked quite well, copy wise, except it ate 'print heads' with regularity at great cost. Looked at the reviews, and decided to purchase this one. Shipped in a big box, arrived on time and in once piece. Uber-easy to set up, just follow the quick-start guide and you're done in just a few minutes. Took me longer to unpack than it did to get it up and running. The ability to copy/fax/print/scan 14 inch legal size pages is WONDERFUL. The print quality, either for documents or photos is very good. The front control is simple to understand and use. The single tray holds about 200 + sheets of paper, which is good. Bought it for a good price (on sale) on Amazon. What's not to like. The ink that it shipped with lasted about 2 months, and I'm a fairly heavy user. Just be prepared to spend about $100. for the replacement XL size cartridges, all 4 of them. However, the XL size will give you lots, and lots, and lots, and lots of printing. For the cost of the printer, ink, quality, and convenience, I think this is a great AIO unit.

Title: good only as a printer
Review: The reason for purchasing an all in one, is for the fax, copy and scan features as well as the ability to print from your pc. The problem is with the automatic feeder, it starts the pages off, but then the rollers sit there spinning while the page is stuck and so the scanner is still scanning and you end up with a stretched out copy on your scan. I contactacted support and they tell me the warrenty has expired. So all they have to do is take a long time to ship it and your warrenty expires, because they use the date when the order was placed, not when it arrives or even when it was shipped. If I want to scan something, I need to manually scan one page at a time.  I can still recieve faxes, but I can't send faxes.  I DON'T RECOMMENT THIS PRODUCT OR ANY HP PRODUCT.  THEY WON'T STAND BEHIND THEIR PRODUCTS.

Title: wastes paper and ink like big govt
Review: prints half and/or fractional pages about 20% of the time. I use new high quality paper. I'm tired of yelling at this obnoxious machine

Title: Love this printer!
Review: This printer meets and exceeds all of my criteria for an all-in-one printer:1) I don't print a lot at home, but I wanted to be able to print in color. Even in draft mode, its printed pages look great.2) I needed a high-quality scanner, and the ability to create searchable text from those scanned pages using OCR. This printer does the job well.3) The double-sided printing feature saves time and paper.4) Plus, it's highly recommended by Consumer Reports. (It earned 70 points and a 'Recommended Buy' rating - while the highest all-in-one-printer tested earned 75 points.)5) It was really easy to set up and start using.It's a little bulky, but it's got a sturdy case. If you're debating between all-in-ones, try it. You won't be disappointed.

Title: Won't feed any paper other than HP
Review: Replaced a 5 year old HP with this.  Loved my old HP.  Hate this one.  Can only use HP paper, and even then the photo paper does not feed well.  Sometimes have to make a slight bend in paper to get it to feed (found this after googling 'HP won't feed paper')Printer is loud and just seems generally less well made that the older ones.  Boo HP!!

Title: A very good machine.
Review: This machine has had to weather a reconstruction with all the dust and motion etc. It works. It just works. No problems with dust, no problems reading screen, and does what it is made to do, no fuss.In an office like ours, it does the job we got it for. All we can ask.

Title: Best HP Printer I ever bought
Review: Switched to Lexmark 5 years after a decade of HP printers. HP has improved tremendously since.Let's see if it last.

Title: Great print quality, lots of problems
Review: I have been using this printer for 11 months.  The print quality is great.  Problems:  1. the touch screen is not always responsive.  Takes a delicate touch that seems to vary.  2.  If touch screen isn't responding, there is no way to access any of the features or functions.  3.  Feeder from the paper tray doesn't function well.  Even with optimally loaded 20-24 lb. papers it will jam frequently. Often does not feed envelopes or labels, just 'ignores' them. Plus, it has a really, really hard time with card stock (anything from 60-85 lb. is nearly impossible to print on, so forget about greeting cards or photos).  On previous models you could manually assist the feed to get it to take heavier paper.  On this model you cannot access the paper tray during printing, so you have no way to 'help' the feed.  Result, lots of paper jams, lots of wasted paper and lots of cursing.  4. The display frequently says there is a missing ink cartridge (when they are full and properly loaded), but there is only one way to access the cartridges, and that is by opening the front panel, but that does not work.  The only way to access the cartridges is if a cartridge is truly empty, then opening the panel works.  But for dealing with these frequent erroneous messages there is no way to resume function except to reboot the printer, which is a time-consuming process.  Result:  more cursing.  Sometimes that doesn't work either and you have to reboot your computer, too. 5. Printing of multiple pages of a single document is fast, BUT uploading to the printer is not.  There is a long delay in scanning a copy and in printing from computer. If you want to copy or print one or two copies of anything, which I do stacks of frequently, this makes the process SLOW. I  We have owned HP MFPs for over 20 years, and have an old HP LaserJet 2300 PC L6 that is still functioning perfectly after many years.  Our previous HP MFPs, while not lasting more than a couple of years, worked well.  This one has been continually frustrating.  This is the first time we will be buying a new MFP before the old one dies.

Title: nice size
Review: lots of features, nice size does not take up alot of desk space. for a home office this is the ideal office all in one

Title: Poor Warranty and Customer Service
Review: The printer stopped working about 35 days after receiving it.  I had to contact HP warranty department as I was past the Amazon 30 day warranty.  Bummer.  HP was quick to identify the problem, a defective printhead, but took a couple days to process a replacement part and then used a delivery method (Fed-X ground) that took 7 business day to arrive (Phoenix AZ).Instead of resolving the problem ASAP, HP aggrevated the situation by making my downtime 2 weeks instead of 2 days.Based on HP's poor warranty response and poor customer service, I would not recommend their products and will be selecting another brand in the future.

Title: HP 8600 All in one.
Review: Does it all. Prints quickly, copies accurately, scans and even faxes. Easy to set up. The fax was easy also. Great buy.

Title: Best Printer I've Ever Owned
Review: I am a real estate agent, a busy mom and a college student (MBA). I use this printer for all my important printing. HP hit all the marks on this one. Reliable, easy to connect, thorough solutions, duplexer, auto doc feeder. My mom loves that I can email documents to her printer and they are there for her to pick up. I would buy again, and I recommend to anyone who will listen.

Title: Great printer
Review: This remarkable printer connects to my wired and wireless computers and iPads simultaneously. Very easy to setup and has an extensive list of abilities. Makes printing from the iPad a no-brainer.The product is accurate in its amazon.com description. It was well packaged and arrived in pristine condition. The delivery was on schedule. I recommend the product and distributor to everyone.

Title: Please stop me before I buy HP wireless printers again
Review: So I always seem to buy into HP printers because of their price point and features.  I do hope I never do this again. The printers always seem to work for awhile and then suddenly, for no reason, the wireless connections stop working. This time, the printer stopped working with all the MACs in the house.  It does work with the Windows OS after restarting the router.  I did get HP Total Care support and I've gotten very nice and very helpful technicians, but once they cannot resolve the problem (after hours of troubleshooting and time I will never, ever get back), they deny it's their problem and send you to places like your router vendor (who won't talk with you), your internet service provider who just laughs that HP says it's a router problem, and Apple Support whom unless you bought the printer from them and have Apple Care, won't talk to you.  Even though I bought the extended warranty,  I actually had an HP corporate case manager who told me he wasn't technical, tell me it couldn't possibly be a problem with the printer and he refused to swap out the printer.  Ah, technology.

Title: Great features...if it doesn't break on you!
Review: I bought this printer because my mother uses a similar one for her business.  Yes, quite a few of them have broken down on her, but when they work they are great.  She buys the extended no-questions-asked warranty from Office Depot which she has had to use many times.  I figured that it comes with a one-year warranty, so as long as it would last the year, I would be happy.  Less than 6 months later, the printer ink carriage is immobile and nothing will work on the printer now, not even the scan feature.  I haven't even printed one full ream of paper yet or changed the ink!  I don't understand how a company can make such a great featured product with the same weak point, year after year.  Yes, this was the same thing that always broke for my mother, too.The main reason why I give this product a one-star rating is because I went to HP's website to fill out the warranty information and they said that my warranty expired after 84 days of purchasing/registering the printer!  Nowhere close to the full one-year from my purchase date.  It still isn't even a year since the printer was manufactured!  (They tell you its 'birthdate'.)  You have to pay to talk to tech support if you are out of warranty, so I then filled out a questionnaire about why I claim that my printer is still under warranty when they say otherwise.  They claim to have a 24-hour response time.  I'm still waiting 10 days later, and there is no response.  Thus the one-star review.  Hopefully this gets HP's attention.

Title: We buy a lot of these printers
