He assured me that it would not be a problem if I were just to print a few at a time. However, as I tried to print one single sheet of card stock today, it would not print. It kept telling me I was out of paper. As soon as I removed that one card stock sheet, it printed without a problem. So, if you need it to print card stock, this is probably not a good option. Other than that, I think it is a good printer!

Title: Broken within two months
Review: Within two months of purchase, the touch screen does not funtion, thus can not use copy, scan or fax funtions.  Only option is to print from computer.  After contacting Hewlett-Packard, they were only willing to ship a re-conditioned printer to replace the new printer that is only 2 months old.

Title: Sensational Printer, Glad I Waited!!!
Review: A year or so ago my Officejet 7210 was showing its age but was still doing a good job.  So I looked at an OJ Pro 8500. The reviews we so bad I decided to wait for HP to re-engineer out the problems.They did a great job with the 8600. It is a very nice upgrade. Much more solid feel that the 7210 and with more features.I have nothing but Macs and contrary to some reports, the thing sets up and performs flawlessly on Snow Leopard.NOTE: Never use a supplied software on new hardware. Always go to the manufacters website for the latest download.  There is also a special update for Lion as well.The touchpad is like all the recent ones from HP. Not as forgiving as the iPhone/iPad.Pros:- Solid Feel to all the plastic parts.- Setup is a breeze on a Mac- Embedded Web site on printer- Flexible networkingCons (maybe):- Touchpad - it's fussy and will it last.- Cost of Ink.

Title: Only For Plain Paper... and Ugly
Review: Not only does the paper feeder jam when using any thicker stock, but there is no single-paper feed. The tray must be fully removed to change papers, unlike every other printer I've ever had. This makes printing just a few pages on a colored paper a giant hassle. Photo paper causes the machine to think it is out of paper. HP message boards are full of unresolved questions about this problem.Also, it is LOUD. Plus, kinda big and clunky. It looks like Darth Vader is sitting on my desk. If you are an Apple user, be warned that this will look hulky next to your sleek well-designed components.

Title: HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus
Review: Bought this predominantly for scan to email capability and network set-up was relatively easy. I have had it for about a month and the automatic feeder has stopped working.....it pulls in the document but screws it up and spits out so that the scanned version is unreadable. I have tried feeding pages one at a time and still the problem occurs. I used a lubrication sheet to loosen up the feeder to no avail. It's going back and I am getting a Brother.

Title: Great printer
Review: As usual, I did a lot of research before buying this printer and I couldn't be happier.  My 3 year old Canon MX700 crashed when I put in new ink cartridges (official Canon cartridges) and Canon reps were very easy to get on the phone but were unable to fix it.  So having just invested in 4 new cartridges, I asked Canon if there was another printer that would work for me using the same cartridges.  Answer was no.  Prior to this I loved the Canon printer but didn't like the fact that in 3 years it died, so I went back to looking at HP printers.  This one had great reviews and Amazon.com had the best price so I got it.  I highly recommend it.

Title: Great small business printer
Review: Easy to set up with supplied software. I have another computer that has a broken CD drive. I was able to instal the software online, no problem.The only thing I have not figured out (which I have not tried very extensively) is how to print via email, or from my Iphone.

Title: A disappointment vs. its predecessors
Review: I have set up and used HP Officejet 7700's, 8500's and now the 8600 Officejet Pro Plus.  This product line seems to be getting worse, not better.The 7700 was a good all-in one that scanned quickly and was easy to set up on a wireless network.The 8500 had some network setup issues initially but worked OK after that.The 8600 printer itself is fine and connected to the network easily.  But, the print/scanning software distributed with the printer (different from the software packages for the 7700 and 8500)is terrible and even though the diagnostic said everything was fine there were network communication issues.Now that I finally got the PC and the printer communicating over the network after wasting about 4 hours, the SCAN SPEED of the 8600 scanning at 200 DPI is about 1/4 of the scan speed of the 7700 scanning at 300 DPI!  I am hoping HP will issue a software update to correct this serious deficiency, because the 8600 is essentially useless otherwise for scanning multipage documents.

Title: wont feed costco (kirkland) photo paper
Review: If you do not plan to use any NON-HP photo paper,you can stop reading here.I initially was so pleased with this printer:1) easy to install/setup.2) very fast.3) duplex printing.4) wireless.5) etc...UNTIL... I tried printing photos.I have two type of photo paper Home:1)Genuine HP 'Arm&Leg cost' photo paper.2)The very popular Costco (kirkland) premium photo paper.I had no problem with the HP paper.The only way I managed to have the printer feed the kirkland paper,was by sticking a piece of masking tape (as found on a forum), on theback of the paper. This gave enough grip to the picking roller, tomake the paper work with this printer.The same paper works flawlessly in other HP printers and other brands.If you plan on using this printer for photo printing without using HP photopaper, I suggest you to google 'hp 8600 will not feed photo paper'Feel free to share your experiences (successful or not) with me.Ben

Title: Won't start.
Review: Not much experience with machine's performance because after a few days it wouldn't turn on. Worked fine the first few times but the on/off switch became iffy. Finally would not turn on at all even with a different power cable and/or outlet.

Title: Intuitive installation, welcomed ergonomic changes.  HP has finally gotten it right!
Review: Installation was intuitive.  Just follow the instructions on the LCD, and you're good to go within 10-15 minutes.  It recognized my wireless connection without a hitch.  I was impressed with the left side compartment, its new ergonomic design allows for the replacement of the cartridges without the need to yank up the base of the printer.  The additional screen real estate on the display is a welcomed change to the 2.45' one in my previous HP 6500a; everything is so much crisper.  I've only used it for basic printing tasks thus far, but I'm pleased with the quality of the print-outs.  Its boot up time is slightly less than my old printer, but not by much.All in all, I'm very satisfied with my purchase, and happy HP finally got it right!

Title: Good value for the money
Review: Suprised at the the quality for the money.  Mainly wanted it for scanning.  Like the ability to scan and email directly from the control panel on the scanner.  Unable to setup newtwork scan to server properly, however did not spend that much time on it and do not really need it.  Able to scan direct to different computers on network fine, just not a shared network folder (not critical to us & could be a firewall issue on our end).  Have bought many HP printers and scanners and generally the equipment we spent over $600 for we have been please with.  However the equipment under 300 have not been happy with, until now after about a month of usage.  Have not printed much on it but seems to function fine.  OCR that comes with it works ok but not great, they want you to buy a premium version if that is something one needs (I do not).  For scanner (connected via network) and backup printing I highly recommend.

Title: Gets the Job Done
Review: Inexpensive. Very simple to set up & operate. Easy to use controls with lots of optimizations. Large and bulky but still visually appealing. Print/scan/copy quality is excellent and fast.HP alerts are a bit annoying for every time they decide to make an update. The tray HAS to be pulled out when printing pages, otherwise printouts will fly all over the place. If there's not that much paper left in the tray (like 10 pages), the feeder grabs them all and causes a paper jam every time, so keep an eye on the paper levels.Other than that, excellent buy. Gets the job done :)

Title: Stay Away From HP
Review: The printer will not print the left side, of an envelope using Word on my Mac. Part of the return address is cut off. In Excel the right side of the page doesn't print. Both envelopes and Excel files print perfectly on my older Canon IP 6000D and Canon MP 620. Tech support at HP is useless. They are unfamiliar with their own products and how or if they work with popular software.  That's why I say stay away from HP.  This printer will be returned.

Title: Fine for plain paper printing
Review: This printer was easy to set up and it did a nice job with B&W and color prints on plain paper. It was really fast, especially in draft quality. It did a nice job copying double-sided documents and printing them double-sided. Our problem with the printer was that it would not accept paper any thicker than plain paper. Paper as thick as an Avery business card stock or any of those types for special purposes would not feed properly. We returned the printer because we use the thicker paper stock often.

Title: Can't Print in BLACK When Any Color Cartridge Runs Out
Review: Printer was doing just fine until a color cartridge ran dry. Can't even print nor can you copy BLACK ONLY unless you replace the depleted color cartridge.Looks like HP is in the business just to sell ink cartridges, not reasonably engineered printers.  And by the way, this happened while I'm waiting forthe order I placed with HP for the color cartridge combo pack, so can't run out and get a fresh cartridge without spending additional bucks.

Title: HP Cust. Serv. is a nightmare!
Review: AVOID HP Printers:This printer has so many issues.  I probably have spent 5 hrs. trying to get help; stupid or what?Finally when I do get a real person they either transfer me, give me a new number to call or`say' they'll have someone call me right back.Today I began trying to get help at 11 am and it's now 5:32.  I have spoken today with 4 people but I'm still waiting for someone to call back with help.Now I'm trying the number again with the extension they provided and I've listened to music for 35 minutes.4:20 A case mgr. who isn't a teck calls.  Absolutely no help, another half hr. waisted.  Called general teck. and after he checked how to do scan to printer for about 30 min.-he tells me the features on HP printers don't work with Mac anylonger.  Could it get worse?  Do I get an award for patience or stupidity?Printer purchased from Amazon, (thankfully), and it's coming back.

Title: Workhorse
Review: Love this printer. Setup was fairly simple. I was able to get it up and running within 30 min and have my 2 desktops, laptop and Ipad able to print from it on the network. I have not had an issue with cardstock and have printed quite a few invitations as well as documents with this printer. While it is large it's not overly so and was able to fit on the cabinet that housed my old printer.My one complaint is that the paper flies off the printer while printing. I solved for this by pulling out the tray for legal paper

Title: So far it's GREAT
Review: I purchased this printer to replace a Dell peice of junk that they would not sell repair parts for. It is fast and prints very nice. In case your wondering the Printer I replaced was a V715W

Title: Couldn't be happier!
Review: I purchased the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus E All-in-One about a month ago.  I was looking for a new machine that was wireless and had good speed to it.  The touch screen is very nice and the set-up was very simply.  I was a little nervous about setting up a wireless device but when you just follow the on-screen directions the HP did all of the work for you.  I would not hesitate if you are looking for a device that does all-in-one and is wireless.  I also got a great price from Amazon and it shipped quickly.

Title: HP 8600 Plus
Review: This printer is out of control.  It is off the hook.  I was getting so tired of HP electronics that I almost didn't order this thing.  But let me tell you emphatically, I am beyond happy that I did.  When I first got it, I let it sit for two weeks in the box because I was so busy but the HP it was replacing was dying a slow death.  I finally hooked it up last week and WOW.  AWESOME would be a major understatement.  The connection to the internet is awesome.  The speed at which it prints is astounding.  The quality of the print job is excellent.  The ease of hooking the whole thing up, putting in the ink--you name it, was all easy to do.  It looks sleek and super stylish all the features, Copy, Fax, Scan and Print (including double sided) work like a charm.  The only thing I haven't figured out yet is how to get something from my smart phone to print to it yet but that's next on my list.  I would HIGHLY suggest this printer for the office or home.  I can't believe I only payed just over $200 for this printer.  HP is now back on my Happy List.

Title: Excellent economical multi-function machine
Review: I'll start by saying that I think this is an excellent machine.My journey of buying a multi-function printer started with purchasing an HP Officejet Pro 8500 all-in-one.  This was a top-rated machine, and I was excited when it arrived.  Unfortunately, the particular 8500 that we received, although easy to setup, jammed constantly.  After a week of jamming headaches, I headed online to Amazon to arrange for a return.  When considering a replacement, I saw that the 8600 series OfficeJet printers had arrived, so I needed to consider them as well.  At only about $25 more than I had paid for the 8500, I took the plunge.The first decision with the 8600 was which of the three models to order.  The basic model was quite attractively priced, and has features similar to the Plus and Pro models.  The Plus model's big advantage (in our case) was the larger display.  Other features separating it from the basic model are the larger automatic document feeder (50 vs 35 sheets) and a slightly faster print speed (20 vs 18 ppm black and 16 vs 13 ppm color, according to the HP website.)  Had we upgraded to the 'Premium' model, we could have added an additional 250-sheet paper tray.  The Premium model might be appropriate for a small workgroup which does does lots of printing, but in our case, would be extreme overkill based on our printing volumes -- one ream of paper can last us many months!Display: This printer went to my mother-in-law's house - and she's not the most tech-savvy consumer.  We chose the 'Plus' model because of the larger display - and it was a great choice!  The display is great - large, bright, and intuitive.  My mother-in-law has no problem completing most tasks and following the very good on-screen video instructions.Configuration: The printer was easy to configure without even connecting to a computer using the on-screen display to connect to the wi-fi network.  In all, it probably took about 10-15 minutes, most of which was allowing the printer to complete its self-configuration checks and print head alignment.  The software was easy to install on the computer, and the computer was able to discover the printer on the network almost instantly using the drivers on the included CD-ROM.Printing: Print quality is quite good and very fast -- the last time I purchased an inkjet printer was about 7 years ago, and the one this one replaced was 8 years old.  Speed has come a long way in that time!Copying: Again, this was quite simple.  I especially like the easy on-screen options for dealing with two-sided originals and copies, allowing for all duplexing options without any additional fuss or difficulty.Faxing: Also a straightforward operation, there were a few points worthy of comment.  First, the fax self-configuration was great, and I appreciated the self-check during the setup process so that sending a 'test fax' to someone was not necessary.  Also, it worked fine with the AT&T U-Verse digital phone service -- not all fax devices play well with digital phone services, so this was very nice.  My mother-in-law also commented about how she appreciated that you can enter the destination fax number before inserting the document to be faxed into the feeder - a nice feature as the destination fax number is usually at the top of the front page, which is often hidden by the document feeder once inserted.Scanning: The network scanning was quite easy, and worked seamlessly - something not true of all network scan devices.  My previous experience had been that devices scanning over the network have some usability problems, and that they work best when connected directly to the computer.  No issues here, however - it worked great right out of the box with no physical connection to the computer.Driver: The included drivers on the CD-ROM worked just fine, as well as those downloaded from the HP website.  My one small complaint is that when auto-discovering the printer using Windows 7, Windows fails to install a usable driver.  The user must first go to the HP website, download an appropriate driver, then install the driver directly.  These extra steps were time-consuming and annoying - but not enough for me to deduct a star.Ink: The ink cartridges were very easy to insert and replace.  I particularly appreciate that they are simple units and don't have the tape-covered electrical contacts common on the older generation of cartridges which could sometimes come off during installation.Overall: I give this printer a strong recommendation, and 5 stars.  You may need to decide which model is best for you -- depending on pricing, the larger display of the 'Plus' model might not be worthwhile, and the price of the basic model is quite attractive.  For us and our given user, the larger display was key and worth the extra cost.  I'd buy one again!

Title: HATE IT!!!!!
Review: I hate this printer with a passion! It won't pick up cardstock paper and sometimes it doesn't like to pick up normal paper either. Oh, or envelopes. So when you are ready to print something...you can't! I'd be better off with a rock.

Title: perfect small office printer
Review: I was looking for a reasonably priced, economical to use, easy to set up wireless printer that worked right out of the box with my new Mac.  I found it with this printer.

Title: Great personal Multi
Review: This thing does it all...Copying, copy on 2 sides, copy to computer file, auto feed for copy. fax, print in color or B&W, and print on both sides. I found this machine to do more than I had expected from my research.On the other hand, it does not print in as vivid colors as my HP Photosmart. So I am keeping the Photosmart for pictures and the 8600 for all other duties.While the 8600 has capability for wireless printing, you are not able to have both wireless to the printer and a wired network connection at the same time...no matter, I have it connected to my home network and use the wireless network connection to print with the 8600. Works great!I do worry that the whole thing is plastic, but what isn't today.All together, I got more than I expected and am very happy with the results so far.

Title: A good printer--I really like it!
Review: This is the best all-in-one printer I've had so far.  It looks great, is fast and prints with excellent quality.  The only thing I wish it would do is print double-sided on legal paper.  I also would love to have a legal paper tray but that is the upgraded model and for $150 more I didn't think it was worth it.  All-in-all, I would recommend this printer.

Title: Awesome print and scan - Horrible fax
Review: We bought the OfficeJet 8600 Pro last weekend. The setup and configuration for the printer, scanner, and fax was simple and intuitive. The Google Cloud Printing setup was great and simple as well. Print and scan quality and usability are great. Overall, our initial experience was completely positive. A very annoying driver download is the 'HP Driver Utility' which installs a bunch of stuff you don't need. Avoid that at ALL costs!The really ugly wart for this product is the Fax utility and functionality. The only fax feature that works in the software is print to fax. There's no way to setup and configure a fax cover page (basic). It doesn't save the failed faxes, so you have to start over 100% every time. There's no addition and saving of contacts or integration to very common software, such as Outlook or Gmail Contacts. After four attempts and 3 configuration setting changes (on the device itself not through the software) we finally had a successful fax. But....no confirmation page was generated electronically or on paper. The Fax feature is a complete and total fail. Don't buy this if you ever want to fax. I don't even have the emotional energy to attempt scan to fax. Maybe someone else can give their experience.Seriously considering returning. Print = great. Scan = great. Fax = total fail. 66% functionality is not a passing grade.

Title: My First Wireless HP
Review: The set up on the printer is simple and very clear.  I set mine up for wireless and had a small hickup connecting to the router.  However, the help information made it easy to resolve.  Performance is great.  It prints out rapidly and scanning multiple page documents is simple with the top feed feature.I haven't printed photos, but know it will perform well.

Title: Not worth the money
Review: I really thought I was doing a good job researching all-in-one devices.  I even tried to 'crowd source' the information and customer experience on this one.  I have never been more disappointed in my life.  HP used to be a respectable name in printers.  Now, I would RUN and not walk from any HP product on the face of the earth.- incomplete description of it's capabilities. I was really, really, really looking for an all-in-one that could print legal sized paper and print envelopes easily. This does neither. It does have a legal sized flatbed for the scanner which led me to think that it could print legal sized paper. No such luck. Printing envelopes one at a time is possible but only if you remove the paper tray, remove all the paper in the tray, insert the envelope (or envelopes), print, remove the paper tray, re-insert the paper and re-insert the paper tray. Horrible. Horrible. Horrible.- Abysmal support.  I tried to contact HP support when trying to get the machine set up and it was impossible. There is no direct line either by e-mail or phone. There are only 'forums'. I tried Twitter and they were damn slow to respond to that and weren't really helpful anyway.- defective product in the box. It comes with some 'starter' ink. Well, the black ink didn't work so off to Staples I went to buy another black ink cartridge which bumped up the cost of the all-in-one.- terrible manual.  The manual - which you need to download from their website since it doesn't come in the box - is scant on information and hardly worth the time to a) find it online and b) download it.I was on the verge of getting the Epson Workforce 845 and I should have for the same price.

Title: Great Printer
Review: I've had this printer for a week now and I have to say that I'm very impressed. It replaced an old HP 4500 whose scanner and copier developed some irritating lines that I couldn't get rid of. Set up instruction were sorely lacking but my intuition worked well and I got it set up quickly.  If this printer lasts as long as my old one did it will more than be worth the price.  BTW I didn't buy from Amazon.  If you check around you might find a better price like I did.

Title: pharper
Review: System XP pro. Home use. High speed internet connection. Easy set up. Clear instructions. Quiet. Have used the fax (send only), copy and print modes. We are using the wireless capability with two laptop computers accessing the printer--no problems while printing. Color printing was excellent using Kodak glossy photo paper. Ink cartridges are expensive, so I'm hoping they will last a long time. Black print fast and clear. I have used the draft setting to save ink. Presently, I do not plan to use ePrint feature. So far I am very satisfied with the printer. But I have only used it for less than 30 days. It replaced an older non-wireless HP printer. Purchased during the Christmas holidays from Amazon--free shipping.

Title: Just short of the mark
Review: Ok, to be fair this is not a bad printer for the money.  It answered my requirement for a seamless wireless printer for my home network that would support printing from either windows or mac computers as well as ipads.  Per the many reviews, installation was easy and installing on the mac, the warning not to use the included CD but to download the latest software from the HP website was a blessing.  After installing on my IMac, I successfully installed the software on a HP Windows machine and three Mac laptops and all printed successfully.My disappointment is with the scanning function....I will admit I may have misinterpreted the information on the top of the box 'Automatic two-sided print, scan, copy, fax' to mean it would scan both sides of a document automatically.  The online HP tech suggested the statement meant it would automatically print two-sided documents but the scan, copy, fax was just one-sided.  Since it didn't say that, I asked what he could base that statement on...he simply asked if I had any more questions.  A complete waste of time dealing with an online tech who basically was providing me 'CANNED' answers and really had no clue.So, I'm on the fence as to whether to box the thing up and ship it back and look for something else..  I was using a Canon, WHICH DOES DO DOUBLE SIDED SCANNING HP,  but it had seen better years and was starting to drop off our wireless network without explanation.  I had hoped this would be the fix, especially given the price and the size of this printer.  To think HP can't provide software that allows for double sided document scanning is a puzzle.

Title: Printing with HP OJP 8600+
Review: I have had the printer for a month. I love the way it prints and the speed. Although I quickly learned that I can't do 2-sided printing with color graphics, even in draft mode, without it jamming. The printer doesn't allow enough time for one side to dry before printing the other side. My printer has to set in a corner and it is a real pain to get to the printer, turn it around and access the back to pull out a jammed sheet. I have used HP products for many years and this is a flaw that HP should have addressed prior to releasing the product.Overall, I still like the printer and hope to get years of service. I do a lot of printing.

Title: GreatPrinter
Review: This printer installs easily and works perfectly with all of my devices in a combined wired and wireless network. I have it wired directly to my Apple Airport Extreme via Ethernet and I am able to print wirelessly from my iPhone, iPad, and iPod Touch.  I can print and scan from my cabled PC running Windows  Vista and my iMac running Mac OS Lion.  Great printer/scanner.  I do not use the FAX feature but it performs everything else flawlessly and much faster than my old HP LaserJet P1006.

Title: Excellent Printer, But A Bit Slow Off The Line
Review: This printer is quiet and provides excellent copy.  As a printer, it is a bit slow getting started compared to my previous DeskJet printer; but once going, it moves right along.  It is definitely faster to get going than my laser printer, which needs to warm up the fuser before working.  The network was very easy to set up.The copy, scan and fax functions are definitely slow compared to my laser multifunction printer.Only four (4) stars for the slowness of this unit.

Title: I Love This Printer
Review: The HP 8600 Plus was so easy to set up; the hardest thing was getting it out of the box. It took me about twenty minutes to set it up for my wireless network. I didn't use the enclosed driver CD because I found the latest ones on hp.com and downloaded them in minutes. Make sure to delete any old software from previous printers on your computer before doing this for a smooth install. One key feature that made me decide between this hp and an epson was that if you run out of black on the hp, the other colors can combine to make black so that you can finish printing. The same is true if you run out of color, this printer will let you print your documents in black. I have read that epson printers will stop working if any one color runs out. This has to be extremely frustrating when something needs to be printed and nothing happens. I can print on my iPad and iPhone with no additional apps and eprint where you can email anything to the printer and print regardless of your location is easy to do. There is even a light inside the printer that lets you see clearly when you are changing the ink. According to the specifications on hp.com, you can print on card stock 90-110 lbs. The only negative is that you do have to remove your normal paper in the tray when using envelopes or other specialty paper. If you print many envelopes a separate tray can be purchased or look into the premium model of the 8600 which comes with two trays. I am extremely pleased with this printer and am sure you would be too.

Title: Good buy
Review: Printer was easy to set up and the wireless features work really well.  Keyboard is easy to use.  Still finding out all it can do.

Title: Great product
Review: I needed a new printer that would print web pages, docs and other things like photos.  I don't print much photos but this printer they come out awesome!  I would recommend this printer to anyone who needs a quick print of docs color and black and white.

Title: I am so happy (so far) with the HP8600+ Officejet Pro
Review: After a lot of on-line research, checking with Consumer Reports and reading a lot of customer reviews; I picked the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus.  What a great choice!  Installation was a snap and went quickly without a single problem.  I had the printer up on line and printing on my home wireless network, and had the HP Eprint web services operating in about 40 minutes.  That time was from begining to open the box to complete functionality.  The printer is quiet and fast - a lot faster than my old HP7310xi Officejet.  I am sold on HP printers and am very pleased with my purchase.  I'd recommend this printer to anyone.

Title: New Officejet Pro 8600 Plus
Review: My old HP Printer just gave up and I needed a new printer for my home office.  I love this printer with all the features, primarily the double sided capability.  I haven't had it long enough to run out of ink but I think the replacement cartridges are somewhat costly. I purchased it at Amazon.com and it was delivered in perfect condition.  There is no manuel but there are good instructions in the printer screen and HP has a good support site.

Title: My iPad Printing Buddy!
Review: One of the major complaints about the iPad when it was first introduced was that one could not print from it.  Apple heard us and with the release of IOS (iPhone Operating System) 4.2 the company included Apple Air Print a technology that allows, or is supposed to allow the iPad, iPhone, or iPod Touch to print wirelessly from the device to an ever-increasing number of Hewlett Packard printers like the 'HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus Inkjet Printer.'Hewlett Packard upped the ante with this All-n-One (AIO) unit by including wireless and giving the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus Inkjet Printer an e-mail address (@hpeprint.com address) from which one can print from any computer, iPad--or  other mobile device--via a technology called 'HP e-Print.'  One can also print wirelessly to an Apple mobile device like an iPad, iPod Touch, iPhone etc. via Apple Air Print.Un-PackingMake no mistake the 'HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus' is a hefty printer checking in a 21 pounds.  And while the unit does not require a two-man lift, it will require some finesse to get it out of the box and onto a flat surface.  One unboxed it took me a little less than 15 minutes to completely assemble the printer including the duplexer unit.  Thankfully the power supply is built-in, so no heavy power brick to find a place for.Network SetupBefore connecting the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus network via Ethernet (RJ-45), or Wireless the decision must be made to utilize one or the other communications medium, but not both.  USB can be utilized with either configuration.  Since I wanted my iPad to 'speak' to the printer and print I installed the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus utilizing wireless and USB and I can print either way as well as utilize the scanner to print-to-computer.  Wireless set-up was effortless using DHCP; all I needed to know was the network WPA2 passcode.Wireless Printing & e-PrintOne of the selling points of the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-AIO is of course the ability of the iPad to print to the device either wirelessly (Air Print) or via e-Print.  I am happy to report that both work!As I stated above Apple IOS version 4.2 shipped with Air Print, which allows the iPad to wirelessly 'talk' to Air Print enabled printers like the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus.  Once the printer was set up on the wireless network I could see the printer on the iPad from Air Print enabled applications like Safari, select the printer and print. G that was it, no setup needed on the iPad.HP's e-Print also works like a charm, most of the time.  With e-Print the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus is assigned a customizable e-mail address to which one can forward e-mail's to be printed from iPad, iMac, iPod, or PC as long as the printer is connected to the Internet.  This feature works reasonably well; it is supposed to be able to print attachments, but this is a hit or miss proposition; i.e. sometimes it works, sometime not, sometimes it print half a page.  However, overall, I am pleased with e-print.Software InstallationMy HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus is connected primarily to an Apple iMac 2.7GHz machine with 4GB RAM, 1TB hard drive running OS X Lion Version 10.7.2. Out of the box the software disc will not work with Lion 10.7.2, so I had to download a software update from Apple and another from HP, but both worked seamlessly and I was able to get up and running with full functionality (including scan-to-computer) in under 15 minutes.  And I have to say for the record I like the iMac interface for the printer better than the Windows 7 interface.PrintingPretty straight forward; the software installation process installed a full set of print drivers which in turn give you complete control over the printing process, including two-sided printing.  The HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus can also print from inserted USB flash drives and or MMC/SD Media cards.ScanningThe HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus offers up both a 50-sheet ADF and flatbed scanner for use.  Initialing the scanning process can be accomplished from the included software, inserting a page(s) into the ADF, or the units control panel.  Once an item is placed into the ADF or on the flatbed scanner glass surface, you can push the Scan button on the front panel, at which time you choose where to scan to: Computer, USB Flash Drive, or Memory Card. Once a destination is chosen, you can then chose to scan to file (.PDF is an option), e-mail, or photo.Copy ProcessThis process, like printing is pretty straight forward; both color and black & white copies can be made, up to 99 at a time.  Because there is a duplexer installed two-sided copies can be made in a number of different configurations, including 1-side original/ 1-side copy; 1-side original/ 2-side copy; 2-side original/ 1-side copy; 2-side original/ 2-side copy.  Copies can also be enlarged up to 144%, or reduced down to 25% of original.Working with PhotosAs stated above, the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus will accept input from a number of commercially available portable memory storage devices, slots for which are located on the left hand side of the printer underneath the cartridge insertion flip down panel.  Simply insert the memory card and the photos it contains are displayed on the small 4.6' touch-screen color display on the right hand side of the unit.ConclusionOverall I like the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-AIO, because it works seamlessly with my iMac and I can print to it from my iPad. The design is a little austere; there are no buttons to push because everything is controlled from the color (touch screen) display panel, which might prove problematic if it ever decides not to work.  But, there is always the control set on the computer, so...The built-in wired Ethernet capability, coupled with USB and wireless make the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus e-AIO Inkjet Printer a versatile, flexible unit that is ideal for a small home office setting and well as workgroup setting.  If you or your small workgroup need a scanner/ copier/ printer/ fax, and need to print from your iPad--or other mobile device--in some form or fashion the HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus should be given serious consideration.

Title: Horrible software - not for Home use
Review: If you are OK with leaving the printer on 24/7, then this is a good printer, as all other reviews have already covered. However, if you turn it off, but leave any computer on with the software installed to connect to it, there is one process: HPNetworkCommunicator, that will start and stop about every 5 seconds. This is HORRIBLE CPU waste, and interrupts other processes. HP has acknowledged the problem and said they will NOT fix it. Go check HP forums to see for yourself. This type of customer service will keep me away from any other HP products.Stay AWAY if this is for home use!

Title: Great Printer, Fantastic Features
Review: I replaced a Brother Color Laserjet Multifunction printer with this unit. The HP product is 1/3 of the price 1/5 of the weight and has more features than the brother device. Setup was easy, using the wizard on the device and then 'tweaking' using the software provided. Based on the data from others this device should be much lower cost of ownership in terms of printing than the Brother device too. I am despirately trying to find a flaw with the device, and as yet I cannot. In fact it's likely I will purchase a second unit for use in my personal office at work. It is great to see HP producing innovative devices with innovative features.

Title: All the Bells & Whistles with Reliability & Quality
Review: I love this printer - the quality and speed are phenomenal for an all in one office/business printer. The best feature by far has to be AirPrint - the ability to wirelessly print from my iPhone/iPad without any hesitation. I also love that the printer has an email address so you can print while away from home simply by emailing it! Yes, the cost of the XL inks can be a little pricey, however the cost per sheet is quite low compared to other printers. This printer is full of tech - not that it's a selling point, but I even use the USB port in front to charge my iPhone lol. I wouldn't hesitate to buy this printer again!

Title: works well with Mac OS X Lion, after an initial hiccup
Review: I purchased this printer to replace a Brother MFC 7820N multifunction laser printer, which was a great printer that interfaced well with my Mac for years.  I was initially skeptical of purchasing the HP because I have had problems with other HP printers.  I also read reviews on other sites saying the printer was not fully compatible with Mac OX X Lion.  But I decided the feature set was too irresistible not to give it a try.I received the printer from Amazon quicker than I expected and was excited to set it up.  Unfortunately, the setup was a nightmare from the moment that I turned the printer on.  The printer has a really nice touchscreen but no physical buttons other than the power button.  When you plug in the printer, the first thing that the setup program prompts you for is a language.  I pushed what I was thought was English but apparently my finger actually activated another language nearby and from that point forward I could not read any of the setup screen prompts.  I fumbled through a few buttons that I thought might work, but finally the process ended in an error message in a foreign language that I couldn't exit out of.  I called tech support, who tried to help me do a factory reset, but they actually couldn't figure out how to make the printer return to factory settings!  Apparently previous models had a combination of key presses that could factory reset the machine, but the touchscreen makes this process more complicated.  There is supposed to be an area of the panel that you push four or five times to bring up a service menu, but my touchscreen was completely unresponsive.So, HP sent me a replacement.  I was much more careful to select the language that I was familiar with this time.  Setup went smoothly this time.  As instructed in the package insert for Mac users, I used the Software Update on the Mac to get the latest driver.  I was up and running quickly, printing both from my Mac and also my iPhone and iPad via AirPrint. Very nice.  This printer is fast and delivers high quality text and graphics.I wasn't totally out of the woods yet though--I tried to scan a document to pdf using the printer, and got an error message that my computer was not properly setup for this.  When I tried to follow the onscreen instructions, I kept getting error messages.  So back to HP tech support I went, this time with an online chat.  I was guided through an uninstall and reinstall of the HP utility, which worked flawlessly.  I am now able to scan to pdf from the printer, and it also has a really cool feature that lets you send an email directly from the printer with the scanned document attached.  I have read reviews on other sites that these scanner functions are not supported in Lion, but I can assure you that they are.  If you are having trouble I would recommend contacting HP for a walkthrough.All in all, excellent printer and would have given 5 stars if it weren't for the issues I had with setup and needing to get a replacement sent.  At less than $200 this is a lot of printer for the money.  It has a larger footprint than the laser that it is replacing, but it isn't grossly oversized and looks very nice on a desk.

Title: So techy!
Review: I went to a local office supply store to check out printers.  I saw this one and visually it was very striking.  sleek. dark.  I was looking for a laser printer but I noticed this did 23 ppm which is comparable to a laser.Then I saw all the features.  And then I researched the cost of ink.  It just turned out to be a way better product for my budget.I got a sweet deal here on amazon. And of course I am a prime member so i got it quick.This was the absolute easiest printer i've ever set up.  I didn't even need to turn on my laptop.  I was up and running in about 10 minutes. I even logged on to my wireless network. Boom. I was good to go!  I eventually turned on both my laptops to install the drivers.Which was quick.This is a feature rich product. It has apps...  so many worthless apps.  I deleted them all except for the coupon app.  I'm a cheapskate. whatever.  It has like a news app and yahoo news app and recipe app...  I'm a dude.  I could careless.I thought it was still cool tho.I also was able to set up an offsite printing address.  I can print anything I want (so long as its supported) from anywhere in the world... and it will show up on my printer. I was having lots of fun with that while I was at work.I haven't really tested how well it prints pictures but I'm more of a nerd.  I was doing double sided printing and copying. sending faxes.I really dig the LCD screen touchpad.  It shows full Caller ID info... its pretty bad ass.  I like this machine alot.

Title: Excellent Low Ink Cost Solution
Review: In the past I have given HP very negative reviews on their printers for high per page ink costs.  This printer is a welcome relief.  The Printer set up without problems on a mixed Mac(10.7.2) and PC network(Win 7).  I set up the ePrint feature and it worked fine.  I then tested AirPrint using my iPad.  The copy function worked very well.  The only con and this is very minor is that the scan function seems to be slighly slower than I would have expected - but still good enough for most applications.All in all this is one excellent printer from HP.

Title: Printer that works everytime
Review: Purchased this printer to replace another HP printer that had served it's usfullness.  This printer obviously is a work horse and prints out quality prints and photes without hesitation.  Have tested it on almost everything without a glitch.  Was easy to set up and meshed into our wireless system without hassle.  Set up menu has been designed for folks like me that are not experts in the field.  You won't go wrong with this purchase.  Highly recommend.  So far this has proven to be a quality product.  Using for iphone, ipad and wireless computer printing.

Title: What a Dud!
Review: I bought this a year ago and set it up on my wireless network. It worked fine on every computer I have in my house, even though the HP software is annoying as hell. However, a very short time later, the printer started having communication issues. To resolve the problem I would have to spend an hour or so troubleshooting the issue and finally give up and re-install the printer; this had to be done with every computer in the house. A couple of weeks later, the same thing started happening again and I would repeat the procedure. Needless to say I did not enjoy using the printer.About 3 months ago both my wife and I got new laptops that have Windows 7. And although HP says it can print from Windows 7 the driver does not work. So we have been printing from our Kindles for the last 3 months since those are the only devices that seem to work with the printer.The last straw... about 2 weeks ago we had to replace the ink. Now there is an error message telling me to restart the printer. After doing so, I get the same message. It won't do anything now except use electricity. I like how it becomes a brick only after I changed the ink. Way to go HP. You don't make printers anymore, you make ink consumption systems. How's that stock price doing? Now I now why IT at work won't let us buy HP... they don't work. The last 2 printers I've had were HP and I had nothing but problems with them.I'm going to buy another printer today and it won't be an HP.

Title: This is a great printer
Review: This is the best printer that we have ever owned.  It is easy to use, prints on 2 sides with zero effort and has never jammed.  We have purchased 3 in the past year.

Title: Great printer
Review: Easy setup. I have used every function on this printer with no problems. I really like the ability to print from my Nexus 7.

Title: HP good purchase
Review: enjoy the ease and quality of product and lived up to the HP name.  Well worth the purchase, good deal

Title: works just fine
Review: I must say while shopping for a new printer, I approached this model with trepidation.  So many harsh reviews. so many glowing reviews, what's a non-computer geek to do.  Well, when COSTCO had a sale with an unbeatable price, I dove right in.  No regrets, however my needs are simple.  It prints, copies, and scans  just fine, haven't tried the fax yet, but have no reason to question it.  So a printer with numerous bells and whistles but at a killer price is ideal.....and yet I knocked a star off.  It does show error messages for paper jams, which upon inspection do not exist....annoying but not a deal breaker.  So if your printing needs are basic or uncomplicated, this is a fine machine

Title: Great, but doesn't print pictures.
Review: Printer arrived on the last date promised.  /the printer was easy to set up, and provides excellent paper printing.  However, it will not print pictures.  This is a Problem known to HP, but HP doesn't seem interested in solving it.  More than likely the problem is an unfixable hardware problem with the pickup rollers that can't grasp the different-finished photo paper.

Title: Good so far.
Review: We haven't had the printer very long but so far we are happy with it.  At first I was disappointed as I could not find 'photo album' software for the HP but finally found free software advertised on the HP photo paper.  I haven't tried printing photos yet, but I can now get started.  Suggestion:  Don't rush the initial set up ... I think it is much easier if you take your time initially as it will walk you though step by step.

Title: Great Printer!
Review: So far so good!  It was delivered on time, installed easily and has worked flawlessly since.  Let's hope it keeps it up.

Title: Poor wireless connection
Review: This printer has a sleep function that is not able to be disabled. What this means is that it gets kicked off the network every few minutes...to make matters worse, even if I want to turn the printer back on, then print wirelessly, I HAVE TO RECONFIGURE the wireless connection!! It shows that it is connected, but it it is not available in my list of printers. So frustrating, and totally useless as a wireless printer!

Title: Great Printer! Affordable price!
Review: I've had it for a few weeks now and have not had any problems. It was probably the easiest printer/technology system I've ever set up in my life. I had it up and running in about 10 minutes. It is so good, that my parents bought the same one a week later after they saw mine!!As for some of the reviews that mentioned about not only being able to print in black only when there is no ink in one of the color cartridges, I would suggest that you do your research prior to making a purchase and under the technology behind the printer. Different printers use different printing head systems. There is a great link on HP's website which discusses this in more depth and detail here [...]So as long as you're okay with that, it is an overall great buy and packs lots of features for the price.I use it moderately for personal use and this printer is considered a long-life print head integrated into a printer which has Individual Ink Cartridges (IIC) system.

Title: Day 2 and it's already messed up...
Review: After doing a lot of research, I purchased this printer to replace a very disappointing Brother all-in-one. It is packed with great features like automatic 2-sided printing, airprint capability to print from apple products, etc. I opened the box, and it is beautiful. Nice design. Touch screen worked great. Very user friendly set up. Within minutes I was able to print an email and a pdf from our iphones. The first time it jammed a couple of pages, but no big deal. I removed it and tried again, and they printed beautifully (both b/w). I then printed a photo from my iphone. It was decent quality. I went to bed last night happy with our new purchase. Today, I set up our Windows 8 laptop wirelessly with the supplied set up disc. Again, very easy to set up. I opened a pdf and sent it to print, and within seconds it started printing. Fabulous. Then it started sounding like paper crunching. It was eating the paper and printing everything at a slant. I told it to cancel printing and it stopped. I went back to the computer to try again but the printer started printing again on its own. Now it was eating the paper and printing big gray blocks/blobs instead of text. I went in through the computer to cancel the print job, and it stopped. I checked that the paper was in there correctly and removed and reinserted the ink cartridge. Everything seemed fine. I printed the pdf again with the same results - eating the sides of the paper, smearing, smudging, printing gray blocks, etc. I thought maybe there was something wrong with the pdf somehow, so I printed a test page from the printer menu, but it did the same thing. So very disappointing. This printer could be awesome IF it worked. I don't know if this is a common problem with this model or if I just got a lemon, but this piece of junk is going back.

Title: Love this printer!!!
Review: Printer exactly as described.  This is a great printer!!  Does everything well.  Easy to setup, easy to use.  Highly recommend this printer for a home office environment.  Would definitely buy again.......

Title: Excellent
Review: Very efficient.  Prints images fast.  User friendly.  Highly recommended. Great value.  Images look great.  One of the best HP has put out on the market.

Title: The best yet.
Review: We have had printers, fax, scanners and copiers. This combo is the best of all of them in one machine. Had a great model 6300 and this one is 10 times better. On a wireless network I have had excellent results and wouldn't trade it for anything.

Title: Don't buy it. Impossible to have parts.
Review: this company has become a scam. I bought this printer, actually the model with double tray, a year and a half ago. Last week it started not to pick up the paper from the main tray. Odd. In the last year and a half i made no more than 3000 prints. Anyway i see online a troubleshooting video posted by HP. I try it. Still doesn't work. i call the service. They told me that they have no service anymore for jet printers. If troubleshooting doesn't work, u have to buy a new one. But grat, they make u discount. So basically if you need to replace a piece that costs 2$, instead i should have spent 250$ to get a new one. I asked around. HP and some others don't sell any more replacement parts. Not even to certified repairs centers. So if after a couple of years, once the warranty is expired, u need to replace even the most stupid part, you can't. And this for a machine that costed me 450$. Only Brother and Epson still distribute replacement parts. Be aware.

Title: HP sinks to the bottom.
Review: It pains me to write this review; not because the printer is bad but because of how HP has sunk from the manufacturer of the finest test equipment in the world to an also-ran in the cheap printer market.  It's a riches-to-rags story unique in American commerce.The trouble began in 1999 when HP spun off the test equipment division and decided to compete with Japan and China in the fast-paced computer and printer business.  HP then hired Carly Fiorina as CEO, under whose tenure the value of the company was halved and extensive job losses were experienced.After a series of questionable acquisitions (Compaq, Palm, EDS, 3com), the company announced in May of 2012 that in response to a 30% decline in quarterly profits, the company would be forced to lay off 27,000 workers; in September that figure was revised to 29,000 and again in December to 34,000.In its desperate scramble for profits, it looks to me as if HP has cut every design corner imaginable in building this printer.  I know of two other people who bought these printers besides me, and all three failed after the warranty had expired.And most disturbingly, the failures seem to be due to lack of adequate design margin---plastic gears that break, parts that jam as they wear, and components that fail prematurely.  And there are NO repair parts available--if something breaks after warranty, you either fix the part yourself or scrap the printer.Sadly, this printer does beautiful work, so long as it holds together.  But it seems to be abnormally failure prone, and once it fails, it's history.  Prospective purchasers should look at the number of 5-star reviews for this printer versus the number of 1-star reviews; the sheer number of failures tell the story better than words.  Calculate the odds of getting a good one.  Then do the same thing for printers from Epson, Brother, Samsung, and others, and buy accordingly.

Title: Buy This All-in-One Printer
Review: If you need an affordable all-in-one printer, you cannot go wrong with this HP Officejet Pro 8600. I have owned many printers over the years, but this one is my absolute favorite of all time.

Title: Touch screen no longer functions
Review: I liked this printer in the beginning but after a year the touch screen has gone blank.  I cannot use copy, scan or fax functions. My only option is to print from my computer. After contacting Hewlett-Packard support, there is nothing they can do since my one year warranty ran out.  You would think there would be a replacement light or something simple to fix it, but there is not.  I have now read several reviews of this happening to a lot of people.

Title: Great printer but hate HP's software implementation
Review: Excellent printer that has never failed me. Just for home use and to print stuff for classes.However, if you run out of ink in a single cartridge then you won't be able to print until you get a new one. This is a bs move but a smart one since it means more money for them. I ran out of cyan but still had a lot of black ink left. I just wanted to print in black ink but HP prevented the printing job until cyan was replaced. WTF? I should be allowed to print in black ink even if one color cartridge is depleted. Also, they have chip on the cartridges that prevents refills from working unless you have a backup one to switch between.If you guys don't mind the issue I just talked about then go ahead and buy the printer. It gets the job done and has a lot of cool features. However, that one issue ruined the experience for me and which is why I rated it 1 star.

Title: Works well
Review: Overall I am happy with this printer.  What I do not like is that when one of the 4 ink wells runs dry you can not print at all.  Replacements are pricey.  Print quality is good.  The touch screen is kind of pointless.  It also allows you to install apps on the printer that also seems pointless.Overall good, but I fell like HP is gouging me for the ink.

Title: great printer
Review: I needed a wireless printer and this one is really nice.  It set up wilth no problem. .I saw this printer for more  butAmazon had it for less. I would recommend this printer.

Title: Excellent Printer, but........
Review: Excellent Printer, but, a little "hard" to print envelopes and/or legal size documents... Epson may have solved this problem with their WF-3520...

Title: GREAT Printer
Review: I really love this printer.  Bought one for home and then, later, another as a secondary printer in our office (gives us reasonably priced color printing, AirPrint, and is very fast).  Its very easy to use, and hasnt given me any paper feed problems.  The scanner works well, as does the auto-feeder.  I would recommend this for any home use (its overkill, but great if you have children or some work from home - ability to scan homework, print from internet, take pictures, AirPrint, etc. ) and for light office work.  I dont know if it would work for heavy use - but I can attest.  I have had my home printer for about a year (or longer) with no problems.  So its durable too.

Title: Fine Replacement Unit
Review: Purchased the unit about a week ago.  The setup was a bit tricky with wireless (needed a router firmware upgrade) and finding the proper settings for the fax to work.  After that, printing is quick both for single and double-sided (something I never had with all-in-one units).  Faxing works well too.  I have not tried scanning yet but, so far, am very pleased with the unit.  The only annoying thing, as with HP units, is that you have to remove the paper to print envelopes (can't use rear printing due to space constraints).

Title: If you enjoy paying for Ink that will be used mostly to 'clean the printheads
Review: this printer is for you!"
column11: Even if you never use colored ink, this printer does!  Want to scan something quickly?  Not until this printer squirts out a bunch of costly in for the next 10min.  I recommend staying away from HP printers!!!

Title: I can't believe it!""
Review: My husband asked me to pick a printer because I want to be able to use it for art projects--such as making decals, printing on cardstock, scanning to my computer.  Now that we have the Cloud Drive set up, I couldn't ask for anything better.  Everytime my husband uses it he says, I can't believe what a great printer this is!

Title: Can't handle much scanning
Review: I've purchased two of these machines now.  The first one quit scanning/copying/faxing after one year.  The second one has constant troubles with scanning.  Connected directly to my desktop with a short cable (not wireless), it routinely gets caught in a loop that will not resolve itself forcing me to both reboot my computer and the printer, by unplugging it since it won't shut down. I have numerous IT pros look at it and none can solve it. Technical help desks calls and been a waste of my time. The manufacturing quality of the boards that govern this process suck.  It's the last HP product I will ever buy.

Title: Great Home Office Printer!!!
Review: Outstanding home office printer; easy to set up and does printing, scanning and copying with no problems.  I've only had it for a couple of months but so far it has performed very very well.

Title: Great printer but missing important setup instructions !
Review: The printer is amazing and I would have given it 5 stars if it wasn't for the missing setup instructions. It took me more than 4 hours to get this guy working over the wireless network (I have some patience). I hope the steps below will help other customers avoid the frustration I went through and set up the printer in just a few minutes:1. Complete the wireless wizard setup2. Change your printer IP to a static one (192.168.1.xx)3. Connect to your router and modify your LAN settings  - Manually Assign IP around the DHCP list (MAC of the printer matching the static IP address you assigned in step # 2)4. Open a browser and confirm you can connect to the printer at http://192.168.1.xx (a page with printer stats should open up)5. If step # 4 was successful, open control panel and go to Hardware and Sound > Devices and Printers6. Click the Add a printer link7. Select the Add a printer using a TCP/IP address or a hostname option8. Enter the required info (provide the IP address you had selected during the wireless wizard setup)9. Select the standard device type.10. Select HP for manufacturer and click the Windows Update button to get the latest drivers11. Select the OfficeJet Pro 8600 Class driver and click nextYou may need to make slight modifications to the steps above but I hope these instructions help you set the printer up over the wireless network. It's a great printer and I wish HP had taken the time to make better instructions. I still recommend this printer as long as you don't mind taking the extra effort of setting it up. Once done you will enjoy an otherwise great product.Pros: High quality, fast, stylishCons: Unless you assign a dedicated DHCP MAC and IP address, the printer will drop from the network as soon as it goes to sleep and you won' be able to print. A few router settings takes care of this problem.

Title: works like a charm
Review: took me 2 min to set it up wirelessly. We have it in the kitchen and everybody in the house can print with. We have 5 laptops in the house so it is super convenient.
